Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From a mountainous property that's the only vineyard on the southern side of the Santa Ynez River comes this rugged, rustic and brawny bottling. Nearly opaque in the glass, it begins with aromas of black currant, peppercorn and tar. The palate is structured with chunky tannins and shows cassis, fudge and loamy soil flavors, with a smoked coffee finish.
Name: Refugio Ranch 2016 Petite Sirah (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Though the more affordable line from this winery, this bottling stands out strongly, offering intense aromas of açaí, Concord grape, blueberry, spearmint and a pinch of pepper. The peppercorn and purple fruit combination shows on the palate as well, which is lush but well structured and full of acid.
Name: Le Vigne 2016 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Maipo Valley, Chile
Description: A black color and ripe aromas of berry fruit, cassis, licorice and peppery spice set the stage for a full but edgy palate. Berry and spiced plum flavors hollow out on the finish of this commendable Petite Sirah.
Name: Carmen 2016 Gran Reserva El Acacio Vineyard Petite Sirah (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black-plum sauce aromas are lifted by licorice and violet on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with purple flavors, from violet to elderflower and elderberry, wrapped in sticky tannins.
Name: Le Vigne 2016 Di Ranchita Vista Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very dark in the glass, this bottling offers fresh smashed blackberry and fruity Concord grape aromas. It's quite thick and fruit forward on the palate, with sweeter blueberry and violet flavors.
Name: Brecon Estate 2016 Petite Sirah (Monterey)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark red-fruit aromas meet with clove and star anise on the slightly sour nose of this bottling. Dried red-plum flavors mix with an array of herbs on thee earthy palate.
Name: Hearst Ranch 2016 The Pergola Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine begins reduced with strong aromas of diesel and tar. It continues on the palate in an intensity of perfumed violet and lilac, followed by white pepper and grilled meat. Thick and concentrated in ripeness and power, it allows room for its acidity to speak, freshening the proceedings with ease.
Name: Jeff Cohn 2016 Sweetwater Springs Vineyard Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: For all of its imposing black color and silty tannins, this opulent wine is also luscious and enticing, drenched in superripe and luxurious blackberry and cassis flavors that absolutely coat the palate and linger long on the finish. While not oaky, it has the sur lie richness and viscosity and shows dashes of cocoa, cardamom and clove. Best after 2023.
Name: Sol Rouge 2015 Petite Sirah (Lake County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This luxurious, expressive and concentrated wine combines power with finesse. An ebony color with a thin carmine rim leads to extra-deep blueberry, blackberry and unsweetened cocoa aromas and flavors that are layered and complex. The wine is big in structure but not overripe. It is well balanced, built for a long life ahead but also harmonious enough to enjoy before it peaks. Best after 2025.
Name: Portalupi 2016 L. Venturi Vineyard Petite Sirah (Mendocino)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a compelling aroma of slate-driven minerality on the nose of this bottling alongside violet, lilac and candied black currant. The palate is also floral in character, with lavender decorating the black-plum core, which is also spiced by peppercorns and framed in sticky tannins.
Name: Peloton 2016 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This big bad wine attacks from all points of the compass, starting with an inky color and smoky peppery singed herb aromas and followed by bold blackberry, unsweetened cocoa and espresso flavors that are up to the task of balancing the formidable fine-grained tannins. Expressive, complex oak influences like cedar, tobacco and cumin continue across the palate, lingering on the finish. Best after 2025.
Name: Thomas Allen 2016 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This well-made wine tastes of blueberry pie and lavender—its style big in tannin and ripe oak, yet bright in acidity. Integrated and softly textured, it has a freshness to the finish that invites and impresses.
Name: Trentadue 2016 La Storia Petite Sirah (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: From one of the coolest spots in the Central Valley, this huge but supple wine tames the varietal's bold tannins with plenty of lush flavors of black cherry and blackberry. It is full in weight, with thick but smooth tannins and a compelling jammy richness that makes it easy to appreciate. Best through 2025.
Name: Vinum Cellars 2016 Pets Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: You won't have to wait years to enjoy this full-bodied wine. It finds good balance on a high plane of jammy fruit, fine tannins and moderate oak spices. The famously astringent texture of the varietal is soothed by plump blackberry and boysenberry flavors that coat the palate and linger on the finish.
Name: Spann Vineyards 2016 Lake Family Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine has a dark brooding color and a profusion of plump, dense blueberry and blackberry aromas that complement cocoa and boysenberry on the palate. Encased in thick, luxurious tannins, the flavors persist nicely on the finish. Best after 2024.
Name: McNab Ridge 2016 Family Reserve Open Hand Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: Deep in color and potent in aromas, this full-bodied and firmly tannic wine shows complex cedar, tobacco and violet aromas, has a good core of blackberries and black plums and a mouthcoating texture. With more complexity and layering than most, it's a good candidate for the cellar. Enjoy best after 2024.
Name: Vezer Family Vineyard 2014 Cassie Petite Sirah (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A light dusty toasty aroma leads to much deeper darker fruit aromas and flavors in this big robust tannic, yet polished wine. It has a full body, a firm, gripping mouthfeel and enough generous ripe blackberry and boysenberry flavors to fill out the big frame.
Name: Las Positas 2016 Estate Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Opaque in the glass, this bottling, (whose beautiful butterfly-woman label features one of the winery's newer sculptures), offers black-currant, milk-chocolate and coffee-syrup aromas on the nose. It's rich, thick and pleasant on the palate with chalky tension that delivers flavors of caramelized black fruits.
Name: Sculpterra 2014 Estate Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This staunch, tannic and concentrated wine is wound up tight and will need years to put its best foot forward. The color is inky dark, the aromas and flavors are closed in lightly smoky and peppery tones. There's rich dark fruit underneath, but it's almost unaccessible at this point. It will be best consumed after 2026.
Name: Parducci 2016 True Grit Reserve Petite Sirah (Mendocino)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine has a strong aroma and subsequent flavor of espresso bean, contrasted well against softer elements of lavender. Burly black fruit meets oak and chalky substantial tannin weight, finishing in a swirl of grilled meat and black pepper.
Name: Foppiano 2015 Gianna's Block Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A hit of turned earth opens the proceedings of this well-made wine, which is velvety on the palate with a back note of grit and tannin. Cherry, plum and a floral underbelly of violet give it a lasting brightness that contrasts well against the powerful ripeness of the fruit.
Name: Hawley 2016 Reserve Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a boldly rich, ripe and robust rendition of the variety, thick and concentrated in graham cracker and blueberry cobbler. Still, it appeals in its voluptuousness, finishing in a lasting note of coffee and violet.
Name: Louis M. Martini 2016 Thomann Station Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling, which includes 11% Syrah and 1% Viognier, is a bit reductive at first, showing charred beef, tar and Concord grape aromas. The palate combines roasted meats with black-currant-jelly flavors that emerge through the asphalt character with patience.
Name: Tooth and Nail 2016 The Stand Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine is powerful, medium to full bodied and monolithic in character. It has an intensely deep color, restrained but ripe aromas and a blend of black-fruit and black-pepper flavors that hardly peak through a very grippy texture due to fine layers of tannins. Best after 2025.
Name: Grady Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine, this is a thick rich showing of cherry and vanilla that's intensely earthy in contrast—a mix of turned earth and violet. Integrated, bright and powerful, it holds its tannins in check and allows only a supportive role for the oak.
Name: Jamieson Ranch 2016 Versada Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a syrupy thick expression of the variety, ripe as they come, with big, bold and tannic flavors of graham cracker and blueberry jam. The rich fruit-forward nature of the wine delivers a hit of espresso as it finishes.
Name: Kokomo 2016 Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Opaque in the glass, this bottling is very concentrated on the nose with extracted aromas of blackberry and black plum, leaning toward prune. There's a flash of acid and hint of violet at the tip of the sip, and then the flavors move into potpourri and light blackberry.
Name: Écluse 2016 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dusty dark chocolate and blueberry jam form the center of this rich full-bodied wine, that is thick and gritty in approach. Raisiny leather and meaty black pepper follow the concentrated fruit into a whirlwind of bold ripeness.
Name: Foppiano 2015 Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: There's bright, underlying acidity beneath this otherwise bold and flavorful wine, a mix of dried cherry, pepper and coffee that's soft and satisfying on the palate.
Name: Girard 2015 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: There's no question of the warm vintage that this wine comes from, with its aromas of black fruit, herb and anise. Jammy cranberry and cherry flavors follow, ending with a tart finish.
Name: Hood Crest 2016 Petite Sirah (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is true to type, packed with dark-fruit flavors and girded with massive fine-grained tannins that keep most of that fruit in check. The wine is full bodied but tight and restrained, probably needing several years to reach its peak. Best after 2023.
Name: Mabera 2015 Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Charred grape seed, prune, raisin and caramel-fudge aromas show on the very extracted nose of this bottling, which was aged in Bourbon barrels. The palate offers stewed fruits against a vanilla and caramel backdrop.
Name: Bushong 2016 Fire Spirt Bourbon Barrel Aged Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine aged in French and Hungarian oak, this is earthy in truffle and thick layers of black pepper and currant. The texture is rough and gritty, the tannins still developing in unapologetic power.
Name: Gehricke 2016 Petite Sirah (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Knights Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is thick in impenetrable tannins and reduced oak, taking on a distinct earthiness that is hard to enjoy.
Name: Lawer 2015 Betsy's Vineyard Petite Sirah (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This ageworthy wine is huge, dense and concentrated, wrapping a thick layer of fine-grained tannins around plump blueberry and blackberry flavors while spicy oak shadings add some complexity and seem to offset the tannic effect. It is showy and delicious now but will drink best after 2023.
Name: Naggiar 2017 Estate Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A wonderful profusion of opulent fruit aromas and flavors give this full-bodied wine a big delicious profile. It oozes blackberry, Concord grape and blueberry notes that fill the mouth with ripeness and stand up nicely to the wine's firm, thick tannin structure. Best through 2024.
Name: Renwood 2016 Petite Sirah (Amador County)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This deeply colored and luxuriously flavored wine is brawny but well behaved. It combines luscious blackberry-jam aromas with dark-chocolate and black-cherry flavors and surrounds them with a thick but soft coat of tannins for a velvety texture. Enjoyable now through 2029.
Name: V. Sattui 2016 Petite Sirah (North Coast)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a beautifully polished but massive wine from a winery known for decades for its excellent Petite Sirah. It is packed with blackberry and blueberry flavors and lavishly spiced with new oak. Dark chocolate and maple nuances emerge on the palate as dense but soft tannins thicken the mouthfeel. Best now through 2029.
Name: Bogle NV 50 Years Quick Ranch Reserve Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Broad aromas of blackberry and soy sauce meet with lilacs and violets on the nose of this bottling. The smooth palate offers flavors of black currant and purple flowers that evolve into white pepper, all cleaned up by refreshing acidity.
Name: San Simeon 2015 Estate Reserve Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Intense and focused fruit flavors seem to light up this full-bodied, densely packed wine. It also shows generous and well-integrated oak shadings of cinnamon, nutmeg and vanilla that sit on mouthcoating berry flavors and are framed by fine-grained tannins.
Name: Ironstone 2016 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine adds smoky oaky peppery flavors to the grape variety's natural black-fruit and tannin combo for a rowdy, beefy personality that rivals a savory Syrah. The tannins feel tight, however, and the wine needs time to mellow. Best after 2024.
Name: Theopolis 2016 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Yorkville Highlands)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black pepper, tar and elderberry flavors show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression, which needs a touch of time to blow off its reductive qualities right now. Once it does, flavors of elderberry jam, black currant and pleasing leather emerge alongside firm structure and decent acidity.
Name: MCV 2016 Gemeny Vineyards Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is dark in color, peppery in aroma and ripe and jammy in flavor. It has plenty of the grape variety's famous tannins to make the texture grippy. While not fancy or ambitious, this is a solid, well-structured wine that will improve with time. Best after 2024.
Name: Langman Estate 2016 Raymond's Rows Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Dunnigan Hills, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a well-structured, ageworthy red wine that surrounds ripe lush blackberry and maple flavors with fine-grained tannins and full body. It is big and bold on the palate and will show its best stuff with a juicy chop or steak. Best after 2024.
Name: Matchbook 2016 Estate Bottled Petite Sirah (Dunnigan Hills)

Appellation: Paicines, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extracted aromas of blackberry reduction, elderberry jam, grape seed, roasted beef and hoisin show on the nose of this bottling. There is ample peppery spice on the sip, alongside cooked berries, with an acid wash on the finish.
Name: Puma Road 2014 Pedregal Vineyard Petite Sirah (Paicines)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light for a Petite Sirah, this bottling shows aromas of baked strawberry and black plum with hints of toasted wood and tar. Sour black-plum-skin and purple-flower flavors arise on the thinner palate.
Name: Hungry Hawk 2016 Petite Sirah (San Diego County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Aromas of smoke and rubber dominate on the nose of this rich and full-bodied wine. It has an earthy streak on the palate, too, but it has a fruit core that makes it enjoyable nonetheless.
Name: McManis 2017 Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Matt Villard is forging a path worth following with his single-vineyard Petite Sirahs, and this bottling is a strong example of why. Deep and dark in the glass, it shows aromas of concentrated blueberry, violet and lavender. Mouthcoating tannins consume the palate, but are soft enough to let unique flavors of pepper-spiced cassis shine through, as acid rises strongly into the finish.
Name: MCV 2016 Rosewynn Vineyard Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Charred blackberry, cassis, black cherry and appealing smoke aromas emerge with power from the nose of this bottling. The palate is full of savory, meaty charcoal flavors, showing roasted black cherry along with a rich creamy mouthfeel.
Name: Ultima Tulie 2016 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The Beckett brothers deliver a wine that starts with aromas of concentrated blackberry jam, toasted wood, plum and violet. The palate is floral and fresh, with penetrating flavors of blueberry sorbet that rest against a strong tannic structure.
Name: Chronic Cellars 2017 Suite Petite Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Spicy red fruit takes on the tartness of cranberry and orange in this well-made, well-structured wine from the great winemaker. Varietal in its touch of white pepper and clove, it is powerful with firm integrated tannins.
Name: Carol Shelton 2014 Rockpile Vineyard Petite Sirah (Rockpile)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A bold reflection of the grape's inherent heartiness, this imparts softly robust and spicy layers of licorice, lavender and baked fruit compote. It holds its weight and ripeness well, with plenty of plushness on the palate.
Name: Ektimo Vineyards 2015 Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: From the producer's Pope Valley estate vineyard, and made in minuscule amounts, this shines in a flair of sauvage earthiness, with thick, juicy and superripe flavors of robust red cherry, currant and plum. Strong and powerfully concentrated, it shows balance and good bones.
Name: Gratus 2015 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is 100% varietal and supremely earthy, a mix of turned earth, grilled mushroom and lavender. Made in a big bold style, the tannins are robust yet polished, with a sultry smoothness on the palate. Baked blueberry and blackberry mingle effortlessly.
Name: Carlisle 2016 Palisades Vineyard Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Peppercorn and black fruits gain some violet aromatics on the floral but intense nose of this bottling. It's thick and a bit stiff on the palate, where concentrated black-plum flavors and cracked pepper converge.
Name: Aver Family Vineyards 2015 Blessings Petite Sirah (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Tar and oak accent this thick, tannic and intense red, 100% varietal and well made to showcase the fruit. Blackberry and jammy blackberry flavors are densely packed, with the wine finishing soft and round.
Name: Clif Family 2016 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: Made entirely from one variety, this is a showcase for the grape—a soft, robust and undeniably dense layering of full-bodied leather, blueberry and baked plum. Thick and rich, it shows moderate complexity and structure.
Name: Terra Valentine 2015 Petite Sirah (Spring Mountain District)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 8% Syrah, the grapes primarily from Rossi Ranch in Sonoma Valley, this is a thick, leathery and tannic red, well made and mannered but undeniably varietal. The tastes lean into biscuit and blackberry cobbler.
Name: Carlisle 2016 Petite Sirah (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This opens in a reduced note of diesel and tar, the midpalate tart and tangy in red fruit. Thick grippy tannins emphasize the weight and breadth of the experience.
Name: J.R. Storey 2016 Untitled Gaddis Vineyard Old Vine Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thin layers of blueberry are seasoned with a touch of baking spice in this soft, simply structured and 100% varietal wine. With teases of grilled meat, lavender and black pepper, it finishes in an intensity of grippy tannin.
Name: Miro 2016 Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: A tiny production from estate fruit, this is big-boned and grippy in blackberry, plum and cocoa powder, the tannins firm and undeniable in their presence. The wine finishes soft in texture and lightly spiced.
Name: Summit Lake 2013 Sophia Lynn Estate Petite Sirah (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Juicy and tannic, this robust expression of baked blueberry and blackberry has an underlying softness that's hard to resist and makes it rounded and approachable.
Name: Girard 2014 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Reduced, thick and grippy, this red is unduly robust and difficult to decipher, the fruit 100% varietal. The oak is pronounced, a majority of it new.
Name: I Mille 2015 Petite Sirah (Rockpile)

Appellation: Paso Robles Estrella District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Opaque in the glass, this bottling from a district in east Paso Robles shows espresso, tar, roast beef and pepper on the complex nose. There's an herbal quality to the sip as well as a violet note, set against elderberry fruit and held up by loads of acid and tannin.
Name: Pianetta 2016 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles Estrella District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Joyous aromas of black currant are spiced by pepper and charred meat on the nose. There's a violet aspect to the palate that floats above a backdrop of game, singed sage and coffee flavors.
Name: Robert Hall 2015 Cavern Select Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Petite Sirah isn't known for aging well, and this one is already starting to show a little why, with lots of prune, raisin and coffee-liqueur elements on the nose. The acid pops and tannins firm up on the palate, which is lavish with cooked blackberry fruit.
Name: Seven Angels 2014 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is 100% varietal, aged in a mixture of French and other European oak (55% new). The aromas offer notes of wood, vanilla, dried cherry and herb. Plentiful, full-bodied cranberry flavors follow. The tannins give an astringent squeeze that distracts.
Name: Maryhill 2015 Vineyard Series Art Den Hoed Petite Sirah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: This outstanding wine compares well to cool-climate Syrahs, especially its aromas of French oak, new leather and turned earth. It has a deep, dark color, complex aromas, intense blackberry and coffee-bean flavors and a full but not overbearing body. The firm tannins provide good grip without drying. Best after 2021.
Name: Boatique 2016 Petite Sirah (Red Hills)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is raucous and raw-boned, exuding a powerful black-pepper aroma and a mouthcoating palate of beef, pepper, singed rosemary and blackberry. Owing some of its wild character to the use of 50% whole-cluster fermentation, the wine is medium to full in body, quite tannic and bone dry. It's not for the faint of heart, but the adventurous will love it.
Name: Halcón 2016 Tierra Petite Sirah (Yorkville Highlands)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: If cool-climate Petite Sirah ever becomes a trend, this bottling will lead the pack. Aromas of cracked pepper, tar and hearty black plum lead into a palate where boysenberry is lifted by white pepper, thyme and rosemary. It's zesty and fascinating.
Name: Jaffurs 2016 Thompson Vineyard Petite Sirah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This immensely concentrated and densely layered wine is impressive for its deep dark color, intense blackberry and dark-chocolate aromas, saturated blueberry flavors and a thick wrapping of fine-grained tannins. Fans of big rich wines will love it now, with a roasted or grilled chunk of meat, and it will age well. Best after 2023.
Name: Binz 2015 Oleta Vineyard Petite Sirah (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Lavish oak spices soften and complement the concentrated fruit flavors of this full-bodied, thickly textured wine. It shows hints of wood smoke and baking spices in the aroma and cinnamon and cardamom notes on the palate as a rich layer of fine-grained tannins coats the tongue. It's delicious and stylish.
Name: Amador Cellars 2015 Karmere Vineyards Petite Sirah (Amador County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is bold and straightforward, with just a little oak spiciness and a generous supply of black-fruit flavors and fine-grained tannins. It has a sense of layering and creaminess that keeps it drinkable despite the tannic grip. Best after 2023.
Name: Concannon 2016 Captain Joe's Reserve Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intense black-plum and cassis aromas show on the sharp nose of this bottling. There is solid tannic tension to the palate, where black fruit and dark spice flavors are lifted by strong acidity.
Name: McClain Cellars 2016 Family Values Petite Sirah (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An exotic earthy character dominates this dark-colored, full-bodied and firmly tannic wine, giving it a rustic feral appeal that gets progressively more enjoyable on the palate and finish. Blackberry and blueberry flavors underneath add to its appeal. Best after 2023.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2016 Petite Sirah (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A beefy, savory aspect gives this concentrated and full-bodied wine some nice complexity. Its richly layered tannins coat the mouth while deep and persistent blueberry and blackberry flavors taste compelling and delicious. Best after 2023.
Name: Rowdy Bush 2016 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A deep dark color leads to floral and cinnamon aromas, nicely concentrated blueberry and boysenberry flavors and a multi-layered texture due to fine-grained tannins. This wine has delicious richness and ripeness that outweigh the varietal's typical astringency.
Name: Klinker Brick 2015 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: Rich boysenberry flavors and a hint of sweetness make this wine easy to sip in spite of its full body and rather thick tannins. It delivers blackberry-jam and mocha accents while the broad texture seems to coat the sides of the mouth.
Name: Vezer Family Vineyard 2015 Cassie Petite Sirah (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is one of the lightest-tasting and most charming examples of a notoriously blunt and tannic varietal. Cherries and violets accent the aromas, bright black-cherry flavors brighten the palate and a moderately tannic texture gives a snap to the mouthfeel.
Name: Berryessa Gap 2016 Petite Sirah (Yolo County)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Oak spiciness lights up the bouquet and flavors of this full-bodied firmly tannic wine. It's not as heavy in alcohol as some, but is very rich in flavors of black plums and blackberries, black pepper and light oak char, and has a good, grippy texture.
Name: Criss Cross 2016 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This big wine strikes a good balance between ripe delicious fruit flavors and the notorious tannic bite of the varietal. Black cherry and blackberry fill the aroma and flavors, while a very firm texture gives them plenty of support.
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2015 Petite Sirah (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Very concentrated and very tannic, this wine is young and tightly wound, so it will need plenty of time to reach peak enjoyment. The black-pepper, cranberry and espresso flavors are enticing but difficult to get to now. Best after 2025.
Name: Parducci 2015 Small Lot Petite Sirah (Mendocino)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine is big, bold and densely textured. Ripe blackberry and violet aromas lead to rich saturated fruit flavors, very little oakiness and a very full mouthfeel boosted by layered tannins.
Name: Berryessa Gap 2016 Durif (Yolo County)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: This wine, true to its variety, is inky in hue and equally dense in style. The nose is brooding and closed at first. Time in glass reveals aromas of ripe dark fruit, dried herbs, mocha, vanilla and dusting polish. On the palate, powerful, drying tannins act as a vice on the tongue. If you can get past the whack of tannins you'll find plush fruit and and oak, too. This is a massive wine that needs plenty to time to settle. Drink 2020–2033.
Name: 5OS Project 2016 Is The New Black Durif (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a monster wine that goes for broke in terms of big bold flavors, full body and massive tannins. The color is black almost to the rim, the aromas are peppery and espresso-like, while the flavors are full of black fruit but also tightly strapped in by tannins. The wine could open up with extended aging, so it's best to drink after 2025.
Name: Lava Cap 2015 Reserve Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very extracted aromas of cassis and burnt caramel show on the nose of this bottling, which is already revealing its age. Plum-pudding flavors meet with a curiously zippy acidity on the palate.
Name: Villa San Juliette 2014 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Riverina, New South Wales, Australia
Description: This Durif (a k a Petite Sirah) is a dense, inky-hued wine, oozing with ripe blackberry, blueberry, dried herbs, wet earth, toasty oak and a savory smokey streak in the background. The palate is rich in powerful, dusty tannins, plush fruit and slightly chunky wood. It's on the hot and extracted side, and unless you're a lover of gargantuan reds, this needs more time in the bottle. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Calabria Family Wines 2014 Three Bridges Durif (Riverina)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This big, rigidly structured wine is full in body, firm with tannins, and shows blunt-edged blackberry flavors that are tightly wrapped by the texture.
Name: Sobon Estate 2016 ReZerve Petite Sirah (Amador County)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: This wine is labeled Petite Sirah even though the variety is normally known as Durif in Australia. If the name confuses, the style won't. In true Durif fashion, this is a dense wine in hue, texture, and flavor. Notes of ripe berries, plums, mint, cola and some sweet oak lead into a rich, extracted palate complete with muscular, chewy tannins.
Name: Flegenheimer Bros. 2016 Out of the Park Petite Sirah (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Candied black fruit and pungent potpourri aromas show on the nose of this bottling from Southern California. The palate offers pleasing floral flavors as well as black plum and mulberry, framed by solid acid that cuts into the finish. It's unlike other Petite Sirahs, but interesting enough.
Name: Wilson Creek 2015 Distinction Vineyard Petite Sirah (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Made from organic grapes, this wine has an impressively deep color that stays concentrated right to the dark-red rim. The nose brings violets, blueberries and black pepper, and the flavors gush dark fruit and dark chocolate, with hardly any oak influence. A surprisingly gentle layer of fine-grained tannins smooths the texture and soothes the palate. Best after 2023.
Name: Barra of Mendocino 2016 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Mendocino)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely concentrated, flavorful and full bodied, this brawny wine has an inky dark color, exotic aromas of cedar, clove and blackberry followed by dense, ripe fruit flavors and mouth-coating tannins. It will be fun to drink soon with a fatty chop or steak but will easily age and improve through at least 2023.
Name: Ruby Hill Winery 2013 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cool-climate Petite Sirahs are an utter rarity, yet like cool-climate Syrah, they show an amazingly savory character when bottled. This wine starts with tar, peppercorn, cola-spice and boysenberry aromas that lead into a vibrant palate of pepper, roasted lamb and dark fruit. Energetic and fresh.
Name: Wolff 2016 Petite Sirah (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lavish aromas of vanilla and pound cake with a black-currant frosting show with a pinch of pepper on the inviting nose of this bottling. There is a great range of flavor on the palate, from boysenberry juice to potpourri to roasted meat, and it all rides strong acid across the lightly tannic structure.
Name: Bianchi 2015 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: Complex, compelling aromas of fig, mint and cocoa start this full-bodied wine off with a bang before rich, jammy blackberry and blueberry flavors flood the palate. The texture is quite tannic, but is balanced out by the richness and concentration of the fruit tones. It's a big, boisterous wine that needs some equally big proteins to pair with. Best after 2020.
Name: Two Angels 2016 Petite Sirah (Red Hills)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: Polished tannin and subtle oak await further aging in support of this wine's powerful concentration of violet, molasses and black fig. Peppery, the spice contrasts well against the deeper, richer well of dark chocolate and graham cracker. Enjoy best 2026–2030.
Name: Robert Biale 2016 Palisades Vineyard Petite Sirah (Calistoga)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of black pepper and wood smoke meld with rich, concentrated and jammy fruit flavors in this full-bodied, firmly tannic and impressive wine. Aged in 50% new barrels from France and Hungary, It shows plenty of spicy, almost sweet oak character to offset the dense flavors and big structure. Best after 2023.
Name: McKahn 2016 Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Brown sugar, red berry, lavender and a touch of heat mark this velvety thick and smoothly tannic wine, a hearty showcase of the variety. Complex and interwoven in oak, it finishes in bits of black and white pepper.
Name: Robert Biale 2016 Royal Punishers Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: Huge in tannin structure, this mountain-grown wine includes 7% Carignan and 2% Zinfandel. Baked bread, red fruit, leather and sizable brawn characterize its youthfulness; enjoy best 2025–2030.
Name: Elyse 2015 York Creek Vineyard Petite Sirah (Spring Mountain District)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted black currants, charred meats, purple flowers, milk chocolate and a hint of teriyaki show on the nose of this layered and complex bottling from vintner Don Lorenzi. There is a strong structure to the palate, where anise and wild herbs show against a core of black plum pudding.
Name: Lorenzi Estate 2014 Private Reserve Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: An extended barrel-aged red, given 30 months to settle in French oak, this wine remains thick and chewy on the palate, a fistful of red raspberry and blackberry finding supportive acidity to boost the fruit. Bark, oak and graham cracker characteristics add richness and complexity. Enjoy best 2025 through 2030.
Name: Robert Biale 2015 EBA Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is saturated with dark fruit and dark chocolate flavors while complex aromas of toasted oak, damp earth and new leather add to the enjoyment. It feels solid and firmly tannic, but velvety in texture. Best now–2025.
Name: Langman Estate 2015 Raymond's Rows Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This admittedly huge wine offers tamed tannins, with a generous dose of spicy oak and a hint of sweetness that seem to absorb some of the astringency. It comes off as very concentrated and flavorful, showing an almost velvety texture.
Name: Michael David 2016 Petite Petit Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This generous, concentrated and full-bodied wine has rich dense flavors and a very firm structure. A touch of spicy earthiness in the aroma leads to luscious notes of blackberry jam and dark chocolate on the palate.
Name: Cedarville 2015 Naylor Vineyard Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Thick, inky and almost chunky in the glass, this is a powerful wine, starting with aromas of tar, charred meat, oak and blackberry paste. The roasted and charred elements of the palate are balanced by blackberry jam, white pepper and dried herbs, with tarry, sticky tannins coating the entire sip.
Name: Epiphany 2015 Rodney's Vineyard Petite Sirah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A touch of violet in the aroma is about the only delicate thing in this deeply colored, intense and tannic wine. It shows a spicy oak influence, and has the varietal's usual inky hue, concentrated black-pepper and blackberry flavors and strong but well-integrated tannins. Best after 2023.
Name: Skinner 2015 Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A shade lighter than most Petite Sirahs, this bottling offers dried strawberry, black plum and fresh flowers on the nose. The palate surrounds a core of black and red-plum fruits and is laced with peppery spices, proving light on its feet.
Name: Hearst Ranch 2015 The Pergola Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong woody aromas like cedar, oak and wood smoke are carried through in the flavors of this big and firmly tannic wine. Oak and baking-spice notes dominate the taste while the full body fills the mouth and releases blueberry and blackberry on the finish.
Name: Dante Robere 2015 Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Opaque in the glass, this bottling shows extremely dense and extracted aromas of kirsch, chocolate syrup, caramel and a hint of mint on the nose. It is suave and creamy on the palate, yet rather thick with unctuous flavors of roasted black plum and coffee liqueur. Acid arises on the finish.
Name: Dunning Vineyards 2014 4 Hearts Vineyard Reserve Petite Sirah (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Relatively light and easy-drinking for the varietal, this wine is not too dark in color, has friendly berry and plum flavors and medium body. Some tannin does come through in the texture but the wine stays smooth.
Name: Campos Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Petite Sirah (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is reduced and robust in oaky char and strong flavors of barbecue meat, coffee and leather. Full bodied, it's surprisingly graceful, too, with mouth-filling complexity and structured jammy blackberry fruit.
Name: Eighty Four 2012 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Description: Blended with 15% mixed varieties, this estate-grown red is oaky and robust, generous in youthful, chalky tannin. Mocha, caramel and coffee flavors ride along a wave of sharp blueberry and strawberry, with a persistence of black pepper.
Name: Stags' Leap Winery 2014 Ne Cede Malis Petite Sirah (Stags Leap District)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Juicy, dusty and black cherry-flavored, this is a soft, rich and well-integrated wine, boldly concentrated and complex, yet easily enjoyed now. The tannin structure is impressively built and a good foil for the oak.
Name: Maxville 2015 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Generously fruity in blueberry and rich soft flavors of chocolate mocha, this is a decadent wine that offers integrated oak and tannin and is lush and fleshy from start to finish.
Name: V. Sattui 2015 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Burly soft tannins are both chalky and robust in this well-made full-bodied wine, which is blended with small amounts of Syrah, Grenache and mixed Rhônes. Soy, blackberry, blueberry and chocolate flavors mix well before a softness comes into play on the finish.
Name: Stags' Leap Winery 2015 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Plum, wax crayon and sizable tannins pique the palate of this robust full-bodied wine, made in a 100% varietal manner. The midpalate is soft in fruity berry and oak flavors, finishing in a quiet dusting of white pepper.
Name: Spicy Vines 2015 Morning Song Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: Baking spice, fresh herb, blackberry, orange peel and cranberry aromas are followed by flavors that mix equal parts fruit and barrel, with orange peel notes on the finish. Grainy tannins provide support.
Name: Williamson Vineyard 2013 Petite Sirah

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smoked blackberries, hickory wood, roasted meats and a touch of tar show on the nose of this bottling from the estate vineyard on the south side of the Santa Ynez River. The charred beef and smoked fruit kick carries to the palate, where tannins provide tension yet the mouthfeel remains soft and inviting. A great wine for barbecued ribs.
Name: Refugio Ranch 2015 Petite Sirah (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dense aromas of black currant, vanilla and fudge show on the nose of this bottling from a family estate in the Templeton Gap district. Lush on the palate, yet with firm, chalky tannins and steady acidity, it offers lavish flavors of dark fruit and baking spice.
Name: Wilson Family 2015 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crushed purple flowers, leather, sarsaparilla and blue-fruit aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate, which is relatively medium bodied for this heavy grape, is very dry and tarry, offering flavors of grilled black plums and charcoal.
Name: Scheid 2015 Hames Valley Vineyard Petite Sirah (Monterey)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lighter than most Petite Sirahs, this bottling shows a boysenberry-laced fruit-punch aroma on the nose alongside cola and black-cherry soda pop. The palate is very juicy with plum, violet and lavender touches.
Name: Chronic Cellars 2016 Suite Petite Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine is exceptionally concentrated and flavorful, but retains a hint of restraint in the very firm texture. Aromas of charred wood and black pepper waft up from the glass before concentrated, quiet but deep flavors of black olive, blackberry and oolong tea coat the palate. A massive layer of fine-grained tannins creates a velvety texture that helps carry all the opulent flavors through a lingering finish. Best after 2024.
Name: Enkidu 2015 Diener Ranch Petite Sirah (Red Hills)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is delicious, dark and deep, from the almost-black color to spicy dark-chocolate aromas, extremely rich blueberry and espresso-bean flavors and a very firm tannic texture. The wine easily absorbs a lot of spicy oak and balances it with layers of fruit and fine-grained tannins. Best after 2025.
Name: Mabera 2013 Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Nearly pitch black in the glass at first glance, this is a meaty, gooey Petite Sirah, offering aromas of caramel, blueberry and fudge. The flavors are also lavish and thick with black currant, roasted meat, black plum, vanilla, caramel and fudge, surrounded by mouthcoating tannins.
Name: San Simeon 2014 Estate Reserve Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine pits a mountain of tannin against a torrent of opulent extra-ripe blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors and comes out balanced. The saturated flavors soften the effect of a very firm texture for a grand and delicious taste experience. It has smoky, rubber-boot aromas, lots of dark fruit and subtle oak spices.
Name: Oakstone 2015 Reserve Estate Field Blend Petite Sirah (Fair Play)

Appellation: Galilee, Israel
Description: This inky purple wine has a bouquet of blackberry and juniper. Although its profile runs a little cool, strong raspberry, cassis and orange zest flavors keep the baking spice and menthol notes in check. Strong yet pleasant tannins coat the gums through the espresso-laced finish.
Name: Dalton 2016 Estate Oak Aged Shimshon Petite Sirah (Galilee)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Black cherry and dried plum aromas and flavors give this deeply colored wine more lively, juicy fruit flavors than usual for the varietal. Aged for 17 months in previously used French barrels It has firm tannins, good acidity and medium to full body.
Name: Tanner 2015 Petite Sirah (Calaveras County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This a big and proudly oaky wine that's aromatic, full flavored and concentrated. It shows scents of cedar, clove and cinnamon, with blackberry and maple syrup on the palate. The texture is velvety and smooth.
Name: The Crusher 2016 Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark and thick in the glass, this single-vineyard expression shows black plum and dried purple flowers on the nose. The tannins are soft, mouth coating and eventually quite sticky, carrying flavors of blackberry, black currant, tar and asphalt.
Name: Derby 2014 Laura's Vineyard Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This deeply colored, full-bodied wine is somewhat restrained in fruit flavors and has a firm, moderately tannic texture. It smells and tastes like blueberries and blackberries accented by oak spices and has the varietal's usual mouth-filling structure.
Name: Fleur 2014 Scarlett Vineyard Petite Sirah (North Coast)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This is a friendly, fruity variation on Petite Sirah that uses a dash of sweetness to counter the famous tannins and bring out jammy grapey berry flavors. It's very dark in color, medium to full bodied and relatively smooth in texture.
Name: Spellbound 2016 Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Rather light in the glass for this grape, this bottling offers lots of wild sagebrush and thyme aromas along with dried exotic plums and gravel. There is a slight balsamic tang to the palate, where cranberry, turned earth and pepper flavors arise.
Name: Wilson Creek 2014 Distinction Vineyard Petite Sirah (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Generous additions of oak give this dark and full-bodied wine an almost-sweet character that incorporates maple syrup and brown sugar with blackberry and Bing cherry flavors. It feels firm and tannic but still approachable.
Name: Plungerhead 2016 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: Rather light in texture and body for this notoriously tannic varietal, the wine has plenty of blackberry and boysenberry flavors, a rich and moderately firm mouthfeel and an almost jammy finish.
Name: People's Wine Revolution 2014 Bea's Knees Oberti Vineyard Petite Sirah (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's tire rubber, flower, cherry, cranberry and herb aromas lead to surprisingly elegant cherry flavors speckled with black pepper notes. The concentration seems light.
Name: Watermill 2016 Windy Point Vineyard Petite Sirah (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This smooth and accessible wine is sturdy in texture, has good blackberry and black-pepper flavors and a medium to full body. The color is a bit light for the varietal and the tannins are firm but far from oppressive.
Name: Sentivo 2012 Estate Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This gets more than two years in mostly new American oak, as well as a sprinkling of Alicante Bouschet. Pepper, meat and violet rise from the nose, complementing the fleshy fruity blueberry that is to come. Full bodied, the wine is velvety soft and supple in texture and balanced in weight.
Name: Carol Shelton 2014 Florence Vineyard Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Maipo Valley, Chile
Description: An opaque color and inky aromas of graphite, blackberry and pipe tobacco introduce this saturated, over-the-top Petite Sirah. It tastes of pencil lead, chocolate, vanilla and ripe black fruits—predominantly cassis. A long, chocolaty finish is the only way for this jammy fruit bomb to end.
Name: Santa Rita 2013 Bougainville Petite Sirah (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Perfumed in leather, violet and cedar, this wine is ripe and intensely dense in blackberry and blueberry cobbler, with a soft underlying structure.
Name: The Lost Chapters 2014 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick and dense with a strong grapey character, this wine is raisiny in baked plum as well as richly layered with a taste of cherry pie and vanilla.
Name: Puccioni 2015 Puccioni Ranch Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a single vineyard that is not specified, this is an intensely fruity floral wine, with a generous body and sizable tannin and oak. The structure is robustly built and the finish is dusty on the palate.
Name: Gagnon Cellars 2015 Single Vineyard Petite Sirah (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dark and inky in color, this 100% varietal wine is thick, dense and simple in approach, with mountain-size tannins. Leather saddle, earth and blackberry dipped in chocolate make up the flavor profile.
Name: I Mille 2014 Petite Sirah (Rockpile)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sweet in plum, vanilla and brown sugar, this wine is raisiny, soft and somewhat unstructured.
Name: Highland Valley 2015 Petite Syrah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Petite Sirah benefits from aging in a portion of new oak barrels, and this one is a great example. It has wonderful spicy cinnamon and cedar aromas, massive ripe blackberry flavors and baking-spice accents from the oak. The color is black with a dark red rim, and the mouthfeel is broad and nicely astringent due to a high level of fine-grained tannnins. It's very full-bodied, too.
Name: Trinitas 2015 Old Vine Petite Sirah (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Very deep and dark in color, this wine has intense blackberry aromas, rich blackberry and dark chocolate flavors and very firm tannins that give a lot of grip on the palate. The flavors are wound up tight and still need time to open and diversify. Best after 2023.
Name: Sol Rouge 2014 Petite Sirah (Lake County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Spicy, almost sweet, oak aromas and flavors meld nicely with the intense black-fruit flavors and firm, mouth-clinging tannins of this inky-looking full-bodied wine. It has cinnamon, clove, black-pepper and blackberry aromas and deep concentrated blueberry and dark chocolate flavors that should only improve with time. Best after 2023.
Name: Le Casque 2015 Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intriguing, deep and dark on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of root beer, black-cherry sauce and vanilla. Framed by upright yet polished tannins on the palate, fresh flavors of blackberry and blueberry are lifted by vanilla spice. This is an easy-to-like, yet heavy-duty, wine.
Name: J. Lohr 2015 Tower Road Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This is a dramatic full-bodied wine that is very concentrated in flavor, very tannic in texture, but nevertheless finds good balance. It has meaty beefy smoky aromas, rich blackberry and black-pepper flavors and a lingering finish. It's one more pearl on a long string of great values by Bogle, and should age well through at least 2023.
Name: Bogle 2015 Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Brawny and tannic, this dark-colore, full-bodied and firm-textured wine has tasty blackberry and black pepper flavors that are bound up tightly by a thick layer of tannin. It will take a lot of patience but the wine may be fantastic when well aged. Best after 2028.
Name: Vasco Urbano 2015 Brunswick; Casa de Vinas Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crushed black cherry, cherry pits and snapped sage stems show on the woody nose of this bottling. There is an extreme chalky texture to the sip, where black-currant and licorice flavors lead into a minty finish.
Name: Harmony Cellars 2015 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is dark and rich but also very approachable for this notoriously tannic varietal. The tannins are moderate and the blackberry and blueberry flavors so concentrated that they balance out the tannins and make the mouth feel velvety.
Name: Boeger 2015 Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded aromas of black cherry, cola and vanilla meet with more intense expressions of violet and white pepper on the nose of this wine, one of the few Petite Sirahs grown in this county. Black-cherry syrup meets with savory tones of toasted beef and black pepper on the palate, which is framed by polished tannins.
Name: Jaffurs 2016 Thompson Vineyard Petite Sirah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Margarita Ranch, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh violets and rose petals make for a florally dominated nose, but there's also blackberry sorbet on this bottling. Crisp flavors of violet, blackberry paste and blueberry make for a fulfilling sip.
Name: Ancient Peaks 2014 Petite Sirah (Santa Margarita Ranch)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep and fresh black currant aromas meet with dried fennel on the nose of this bottling by a winery based in Los Angeles. A penetrating acidity kicks off the sip, where solid tannins carry dark fruit and rosemary flower flavors.
Name: The Blending Lab 2015 PS Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried herbs, elderberries, peppercorns and a strong streak of gamy meat show on the nose of this bottling, which is less dense and more nuanced in style than many other Petite Sirahs. The gamy element extends to the palate, giving complexity to the black fruits and sticky tannins.
Name: Le P'tit Paysan 2014 Petite Sirah (Monterey County)

Appellation: South Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: Boysenberry, black pepper, dark spices and a hint of sandalwood show on the nose of this bottling, a good indication that Petite Sirah may thrive in this warmer Southern California climate. Rustic flavors of leather, dust, roasted blackberries and teriyaki are lifted with a pinch of purple flowers.
Name: Hawk Watch Winery 2014 Petite Sirah (South Coast)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried blueberry, loamy soil, anise and roasting herbs of oregano, thyme and marjoram show on the nose of this bottling. Roasted blackberry flavors show on the slightly sweet-seeming sip, which is made complex by pepper and charred meat.
Name: Le Vigne 2015 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated and ripe black-currant aromas meet with brown sugar on the intense nose of this bottling. Softer blueberry flavors show on the fruity, ripe sip, framed by grippy tannins.
Name: Hoyt Family Vineyards 2013 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dense loamy soils and crushed basalt frame the earthy nose of this bottling, which is deep and dark and shows a hint of caramel as well. The palate is extremely chewy and thick with tannins and muddy clay flavors that barely allow the blueberry and blackberry fruit to arise.
Name: Le Vigne 2015 Di Ranchita Vista Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a thick, peppery take on the variety, with potent tannins. It has a strong streak of vanilla running right through the center.
Name: Agate Ridge 2015 Petite Sirah (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Matt Villard's focus on Petite Sirah delivers standout results in this voluptuous bottling, starting with a nose that's heavy in black currant and caramel ripeness yet cut by a savory core of charred beef, peppercorn and crushed slate. The palate matches the nose, with flavors of dense black fruit, more meat and white pepper riding lively acidity into the finish.
Name: MCV 2015 Rosewynn Vineyard Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This dessert wine is made entirely from Petite Sirah grown on the mountainous vineyard site atop Atlas Peak. It tastes and smells of salty leather as big bold flavors of cinnamon cola and black pepper weigh in. The palate is thick, dense and richly layered.
Designation: D'oro Stagecoach Vineyard Red Dessert Wine
Name: Patland 2014 D'oro Stagecoach Vineyard Red Dessert Wine Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crushed elderberry, lilac, violet, black pepper and teriyaki arise on the nose, although in a reserved manner, for this single vineyard expression. Roasted blackberry and chipped asphalt flavors show on the dark, brooding sip, with slightly tough tannins and level acidity framing the palate.
Name: MCV 2015 Gemeny Vineyard Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of cherry Fruit Roll-up, woodspice, cough syrup and game show some heat. The palate is full bodied and rich, with fruit and game flavors backed by big, firm tannins.
Name: Covington 2013 Petite Sirah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied black grape and black currant aromas make for a rather sweet nose on this bottling. The palate is much more complex, with layers of blackberry preserves, thyme, dark chocolate and violets, cut through with a fairly searing acidity.
Name: Labyrinth 2014 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: Brooding aromas of green wood, dill, smoke and purple fruit are followed by a palate that mixes equal parts fruit and barrel, with tart acidity providing the frame. There are some interesting things going on but they don't all come together.
Name: Huston 2014 Private Reserve Petite Sirah

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Large doses of smoky oak and sweet spices light up this powerful full-bodied dessert wine, which is very sweet and has an almost thick, viscous texture that coats the mouth.
Name: Sonoma Port Works 2012 Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: Unsettled aromas of plum, smoke, hot pepper and green wood lead to a light-bodied, smoky palate backed by firm, gritty tannins. It doesn't all come together.
Name: Ste. Chapelle 2015 Panoramic Idaho Petite Sirah

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Not entirely settled aromas of barrel spice, mint and blue fruit are followed by tart fruit flavors that come up quite short. Enjoy this straightforward wine soon.
Name: Three of Cups 2014 Le Croyant Petite Sirah (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: This excellent wine from a steep terraced vineyard offers beautiful aromas of lavender and violet that segue to a palate replete with black fruit, black pepper and anise tones. Each flavor seems especially well defined and they layer together harmoniously on a velvety texture that provides good support for all that concentration. Best after 2020.
Name: Halcón 2015 Tierra Petite Sirah (Yorkville Highlands)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Superrich and undeniably flavorful, this stand-out wine achieves fine balance despite the huge tannins. It has an utterly dark color that stains the glass, wonderful aromas of crushed raspberries and black cherries, and deep fruit flavors that weave through tones of dark chocolate and mint. The mouthfeel is notably dense but somehow gentle. Best from 2020–2030.
Name: Portalupi 2015 L. Venturi Vineyards Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is super dark in hue and packed full of blackberry, wood smoke and black pepper flavors. It brings a relatively light (for the varietal) mouthfeel considering that it does have a wealth of fine-grained tannins and elevated alcohol. Drink now with a steak or chop, or cellar until 2025 for more maturity and nuance.
Name: Lava Cap 2014 Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tasty, spicy oak nuances give a great lift to this frankly heavy, massively built wine that is very full bodied and has a thick layer of chewy tannins. Hints of toasted walnuts, cinnamon and nutmeg weave through dark chocolate, blackberry and espresso flavors that are concentrated and deep.
Name: Rubino Estates Winery 2015 Riserva Collection Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a supple and sexy version of a notoriously tannic wine. It has a deep dark color, enticing dark chocolate and blackberry aromas and a thick layer of berries and black cherries on the palate. Tightly meshed tannins give it plenty of pucker power, and mean that this wine can age for quite a while. Best from 2020 to 2025.
Name: Concannon 2014 Reserve Polo Field Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An abundance of spicy smoky oak aromas meets equally abundant flavors of dark chocolate, cocoa and raspberry in this full-bodied and heavily tannic wine. The color is about as dark as it gets, the mouthfeel is massive and yet the flavors are so big they balance out the huge structure. That it was aged for 30 months in 80% new French barrels explains the alluring spiciness.
Name: Dante Robere 2014 Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This red embraces its main variety's ancestral home, blending in 12% Syrah, 10% Grenache and a pinch of other Rhône reds. Peppery and tannic, it shines in blueberry, cedar, dried herb and cinnamon, begging for more time in the bottle. Enjoy best 2019 through 2029.
Name: Stags' Leap Winery 2014 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: Sweet and spicy sensations complement the deep dark-berry and chocolate flavors of this full-bodied, dry and firmly mouth-gripping wine. Deep and dark describes the color, too, while the texture is drenched with fine-grained tannins that will add to the wine's longevity. Best after 2020.
Name: Chacewater 2014 Astel Petite Sirah (Red Hills)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine has a compelling, exuberant black-fruit character that makes it taste alive and buoyant despite a thick layer of fine-grained tannin and very full body. Blackberry jam, black cherry compote and dark chocolate power the flavors and linger on the finish.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2014 Old Vine Petite Sirah (Fair Play)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A distinctive blueberry aroma and flavor joins with spicy black pepper in this vivid and fascinating but not overly heavy wine made without added sulfites. It's about as elegant as Petite Sirah gets. An almost silky texture emerges despite firm tannins and there's a sense of focus from the first whiff through the lingering finish.
Name: Powicana Farm 2015 Petite Sirah (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Softly textured tannins surround a hefty full-bodied plushness of plummy cobbler, blueberry and dark chocolate in this well-made, robust and rich wine. Caramel and mocha appear on the lengthy finish.
Name: Trentadue 2015 La Storia Petite Sirah (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a well-made vineyard-designate, showing a full embrace of integrated oak and full-bodied richness. Red fruit, leather, meat and black licorice all figure into the mix, as the thickness in the glass suggests decanting or time to air.
Name: Francis Coppola 2014 Bevil-Wolcott Vineyard Reserve Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Oodles of fruit flavor and a sense of sweetness give this bold and tannic wine a softer edge than some others. It overflows with blueberry and blackberry aromas, rich fruit flavors and touches of milk chocolate. It will be nice by a campfire or with a chocolate dessert.
Name: Naggiar 2015 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Not one of the biggest or boldest versions, this earthy wine is medium to full bodied and firmly tannic, offering untamed aromas and flavors of earth, barnyard, beef and wild blackberry. It's funky in a good way, very interesting to taste and has good balance, too.
Name: Barra of Mendocino 2015 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Mendocino)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: Smoky char and bacon give this wine a lot of personality and depth—big-time flavors that highlight a soft velvety texture of concentration. Brawny and broad, it's a powerhouse of ripeness and richness.
Name: August Briggs 2014 Petite Sirah (Calistoga)

Appellation: Judean Hills, Israel
Description: This wine offers a bouquet of black currant, cherry and black olive. The tannins come on strong but never overpower the rich flavors of black cherry, blackberry, thyme and anise. Strawberry and eucalyptus tones show on finish.
Name: Jerusalem Wineries 2014 4990 Reserve Petite Sirah (Judean Hills)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This is a very good, moderate rendering of the varietal, blending good blackberry aromas with lightly smoky peppery flavors and medium to full body. It's firmly tannic and will taste great with juicy meats and indulgent cheesy pastas.
Name: French Bar 2015 Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: This is a giant of a wine, from the heady, dried-fruit aromas to the flavors soaked in espresso and blackberry syrup to the thick blanket of tannin that wraps it all up. It is very full bodied, feels warm on the palate and leaves an astringent aftertaste.
Name: IG 2015 Petite Sirah (Red Hills)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Aromas of charred wood and black pepper meet concentrated flavors of black cherry and blackberry in this full-bodied wine. A hint of sweetness rounds its edges on the palate and gives a jammy note to the finish.
Name: Old Soul 2016 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This wine is very fruity in flavor and almost sleek in texture, but still has the varietal's typical firm tannins and hints of black pepper in the generous black-cherry flavors. It's medium bodied, not too heavy or too astringent, so it will be more versatile than many.
Name: Oak Grove 2016 Family Reserve Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a velvety thick and oaky red, aged some time in bottle. Somewhat herbal in clove, cedar and graphite notes, its texture is defined more by leather.
Name: Summit Lake 2012 Sophia Lynn Petite Sirah (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This is a big bold wine that lays on the oak flavor without restraint. A strong aroma of cedar and baking spices is followed by very concentrated dark-fruit flavors and spicy charred oak flavors. It is quite tannic and almost thick in texture, giving plenty of grip on the palate.
Name: McManis 2016 Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine is slightly bittersweet and off-putting, with a dullness to the texture.
Name: Madrigal 2014 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A deep color and thick aromas of blackberry and black fig lead to opulent mouth-filling dark-fruit flavors and a velvety substantive texture. This wine ranks with Turley and Carlisle Petite Sirahs at the top of the quality pyramid in California. It has all the expected tannin along with oodles of fruity, smoky richness to stand up to it. Best through 2028.
Name: Sirius 2013 Eaglepoint Ranch Petite Sirah (Mendocino)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: Theodora Lee is making brilliant wines from her estate property in Mendocino County. Great concentration and a monumental structure help this wine stand out, even in a field crowded with those qualities. It tastes a little quiet and tight now, and needs time to mellow so that more complexity and richness comes out. Still, it already shows intriguing layers of black pepper, black fig, blueberry and graphite. Best after 2025.
Name: Theopolis 2015 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Yorkville Highlands)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's an impressive density of aromas on this bottling, with black pepper, roasted meat, black currant and tar, yet with a fresh violet kick as well. The concentrated black currant and elderberry flavors are thick on the palate yet cut by tangy black plum skins, salt and pepper and dried herb flavors.
Name: Zenaida Cellars 2015 Knucklehead Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This dramatic and inky-colored wine has tight aromas of pencil lead, blackberry and mint followed by extremely concentrated flavors like berries, black cherries and black pepper, but with lighter floral accents, too. The structure is huge due to very firm tannins and robust alcohol, so the wine needs time to mellow. Best after 2022.
Name: Jessie's Grove 2013 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Parducci has been making great-value Petite Sirah for decades and here's another super example. This is an unusually complex wine for the varietal, offering hints of violet, anise and black pepper, along with rich blackberry aromas and flavors. The mouthfeel is big and tannic, but not overly so, and the rich flavors melt over the palate and linger a long time on the finish.
Name: Parducci 2014 Small Lot Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is nicely balanced considering how big it is in terms of tannin and body. The aromas ooze blueberry syrup and blackberry jam while the flavors are equally rich. The texture is quite firm and tannic but it feels right and will help the wine age well. Best after 2022.
Name: Sierra Starr 2015 Super Nova Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Vibrant blackberry aromas leap from the glass on this bottling, which also offers anise, violet and dried meat aromas. The palate combines smashed black currants with black pepper and violets, wrapped together by serious tannins.
Name: Castle Rock 2015 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is an unusually drinkable Petite Sirah, considering the varietal's reputation for massive tannins. It has lots of jammy fruit flavors, firm but not drying tannins, and a sense of richness that counters the tannin for a soothing mouthfeel.
Name: Graziano 2013 Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Very seductive and spicy, this full-bodied wine has enticing aromas of baking spices and toasted oak, with lavish flavors of chocolate and blackberry jam that seem to coat the tongue. The ripe feel seems to soften the thick layer of tannin, so it's approachable now.
Designation: Seven Sinners The Ransom Old Vines
Name: Nine North Wine Company 2015 Seven Sinners The Ransom Old Vines Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Cassis, roasted chocolate, pepper and buttery pastries show on the nose of this bottling, which is thick and dark in the glass and shows great potential for this grape in Southern California. It's dense on the palate, with soft violet and blackberry flavors, wrapped in a tarry structure with hints of nutmeg and cocoa on the finish.
Name: Hungry Hawk 2015 Petite Sirah (San Diego County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a big, sturdy, and firmly textured wine that smells like oak spices, tastes like raspberries and milk chocolate and has a relatively easy mouthfeel for this notoriously tannic varietal.
Name: Campos Family Vineyards 2015 Estate Petite Sirah (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This massively structured wine from a new AVA within California's Contra Costa County is extremely oaky and extremely tannic, so people who love those attributes should love it. The aroma is like cedar and pencil shavings, and the wine tastes very concentrated, spicy and smoky. It has a grippy texture due to a high level of both wood and grape tannins that leave a drying sensation on the palate. Best after 2024.
Name: Cinque Capre 2014 Petite Sirah (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Bold and tannic, this wine has lots of structure and a firm mouthfeel along with good but tight flavors of black cherry and blackberry. It tastes lean and focused and will pair nicely with rich proteins.
Name: Peltier 2015 Black Diamond Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Lodi)
