But the tannins feel polished so the texture is smooth, letting ripe blackberry and boysenberry flavors come out.
Name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2013 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This young, massively built wine needs time to age and develop in the bottle. It has great concentration of black olive, beef and black-pepper flavors, mounds of fine tannins that build texture, very full body and a lingering finish. Best after 2022.
Name: Lava Cap 2013 Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

Appellation: San Francisco Bay, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intriguing floral aromas like rose petals and appetizing, fresh berry flavors are tempting in this medium-bodied and not-too-tannic wine. While still firm in texture, this will drink well soon, but will be best after 2018.
Name: Concannon 2014 Petite Sirah (San Francisco Bay)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: Big, dark and very young, this full-bodied wine has an extremely deep color, plus aromas like salt and pepper and grilled beef. Concentrated flavors suggest blackberry and dark chocolate, and the texture is wrapped in drying tannins. It will be best after 2020.
Name: Brassfield 2013 Volcano Ridge Vineyard Petite Sirah (High Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine has a bright cherry character in the aromas and flavors along with medium body and a dry, firm texture. Lighter than many of its peers, but still cloaked in lots of fine tannins, it will improve with time. Wait until 2020.
Name: Fenestra 2012 Ghielmetti Vineyard Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a lovely, while bombastically full-bodied, 100% varietal wine, brooding in blackberry jam, peppery cinnamon and an inviting floral nose of cherry blossom. The body drinks lean despite its power and underlying ripeness, remaining lengthy and complex through the finish. Drink now through 2021.
Name: Keating 2013 Petite Sirah (Rockpile)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a relatively light-bodied and elegant version of the variety, softly approachable and enjoyable even in its youth. Leathery pepper sits atop nuanced layers of chocolate and blueberry, with a tang of sour cherry and a leanness to the finish.
Name: Fulcrum 2013 Landy Vineyard Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an appropriately dark and leathery wine, saddle-like in aroma, with firm traces of black pepper. Blueberry tart and violet provide further complexity and invitation.
Name: Muscardini 2013 Trueheart Vineyard Petite Sirah (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a sanguine, meaty and smoothly textured wine, relatively medium bodied and moderate in oak. Twists of dried cranberry and blueberry provide the fruity components, which are nuanced compared with the big hits of black and white pepper.
Name: Rock Wall 2013 Jack's Dry Creek Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a hillside spot, this blends in 21% Zinfandel for further fruitiness, showing aromas and a taste of dried plum, the tannins upfront and generous. Structured and medium bodied, it aged almost two years in French oak that provides additional spiciness and grace.
Name: Rancho Maria 2013 Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A percentage of Zinfandel plays nicely in this medium-bodied wine, aged almost two years in French oak. Spicy plum and vanilla surround supple tannin and a dry, lingering finish, accented in leather and black pepper.
Name: Mazzocco 2013 Maria Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Brooding aromas of dill, purple fruit, vanilla and wood spice are followed by full dark cherry flavors backed by a wall of firm yet still accessible tannins.
Name: Latah Creek 2012 Monarch Reserve Zephyr Ridge Vineyards Petite Sirah (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: There's a lot to like in this thickly ripe wine, so dark purple in color as to be almost paint. Lipsmacking black and blue berries ride a wave of smoky tannin, chocolate and power, the acidity moderate.
Name: Matrix 2013 Estate Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Asphalt, wet dirt, blueberry fruit and grapeseed aromas show on the nose of this dark and dense bottling. The palate starts with milk-chocolate shavings followed by tart red-cherry fruit. The acidity is overwhelming, singeing the tongue, and the tannins are a bit chunky. It should improve with cellar time.
Name: Graveyard 2013 Dark Phantom Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is an attempt to make a leaner style from a variety known for its power and concentration, blended with 13% Zinfandel, another wine not known for being shy. Minty menthol and red cherry give it a fruity composure, while the texture and body glide simply on the palate.
Name: Rutherford Ranch 2013 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a real tongue-stainer, earthy and packed with purple fruits. Flavors of blueberries, plums, bitter chocolate and charred wood abound. The wine remains lively with ample acidity and smooth, though dense tannins.
Name: Spangler 2013 Petite Sirah (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Though younger than most current Petite Sirah releases, this bottling impresses wildly with fragrant boysenberries and crushed lavender on the nose, proving to be a floral-driven style that's not beaten down by richness or ripeness, despite the higher alcohol level that doesn't show at all. Insane amounts of cracked white and black pepper meet with toasted sesame seeds, tart boysenberries and more lavender on the palate.
Name: Jaffurs 2014 Thompson Vineyard Petite Sirah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is big boisterous wine from Elias Fernandez and Doug Shafer that has been given some nice time in bottle after four years in new French oak. It's a viscous, black-as-night kind of experience. Coconut macaroon and juicy blackberry and blueberry substantiate structured, integrated tannin, finishing with an unexpected elegance.
Name: Eighty Four 2010 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Three sources of fruit make their way into this wine: Petite Sirah from Sonoma Valley's Rossi Ranch and Del Carlo Ranch in Dry Creek Valley, as well as Syrah from Rosella's in the Santa Lucia Highlands. Together they offer leathery black licorice and a smooth, yet grippy texture, balanced by decent acidity and length, with a twist of milk chocolate.
Name: Carlisle 2013 Petite Sirah (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blueberry pie, black plum, licorice and a touch of tobacco show on the inviting nose of this solid bottling from the Morgan Hill producer. The palate is very well integrated and delicious, with blackberry jam, vanilla cookies and strong espresso flavors, framed by sticky, prominent tannins.
Name: Clos LaChance 2013 Reserve Petite Sirah (Central Coast)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is 100% varietal from the historic Foppiano clone, the wine marked by grapy leather and buoyant acidity in equal parts. Chocolate and gunpowder show up along the way, before a big grip gets aggressive on the finish, blown off by a few more swirls of the glass.
Name: Bacigalupi 2013 Bacigalupi Vineyards Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine was aged in differing levels of oak, from 33% new French to once and twice-used (also French). It makes for a bold presence of thick soft black plum and licorice complemented by long-lasting texture and a length of leather.
Name: Frank Family 2012 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This Rhone-inspired specialist, who also does a fine job with Zin, shows both sides of the coin in this Rhône variety that in California is more often associated and blended with Zin. Elusive red berry takes on layers of flavors in the glass, becoming densely mouth-coating and intensely rich on the leathery finish.
Name: Quivira 2012 Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: A broad and expansive wine eager in youthful tannin, there's red fruit at the core of its flavor profile, that travels from plum to darker berry. Soft, integrated tannin give way to a light body and restrained weight.
Name: Grgich Hills 2011 Miljenko's Selection Petite Sirah (Calistoga)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: With tiny additions of Syrah and Petit Verdot, this thick, syrupy, full-bodied wine is black in color and brimming in bacon, salami and coffee, with smooth, tempered tannin. It's more meat and earth than fruit, with a baked quality throughout.
Name: Ballentine 2013 Fig Tree Vineyard Petite Sirah (St. Helena)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a Petite Sirah to sit on while the tannins mellow out a bit. It starts with fresh-pressed blue- and blackberries, a touch of lilac, hints of roasted meat and a touch of black coffee on the nose. The dense structure holds espresso, dark chocolate and a ripe blackberry sensation. Drink 2018 through 2023.
Name: Écluse 2013 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A single vineyard expression from this winery's newish vineyard, this shows pressed purple flowers, deep blueberries and a touch of tar on the nose. The flavors are dense, dark and framed by strong tannins, with elderberry, pencil lead and deep lilac syrup gaining intrigue from white sage, white pepper and raw beef tones.
Name: San Simeon 2012 St. Eva Hill Vineyard Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Suave aromas of pepper, elderberry, lavender and a touch of snapped sagebrush show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers slightly sour black fruits of tart plum skin and boysenberry, rounded by a savory soy component.
Name: Seven Angels 2012 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blueberry paste, chocolate cake and a touch of tar show on the nose of this wine, which clings to its aromas and doesn't let them escape easily. The palate is more showy, with purple flowers and grape candy flavors, framed by rather strong tannins. This will improve with a bit more time.
Name: Boekenoogen 2013 Bell Ranch Vineyard Petite Sirah (Monterey)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's excitement about the return of this rather iconic bargain brand to the market, and this bottling packs the goods, offering rich and bacon-laced aromas as well as maple, campfire and jammy fruits on the nose. It's not as structured or varietally typical as pricier bottlings, but it's fun and delicious to quaff, with more maple, bacon fat and ripe berries.
Name: Cycles Gladiator 2014 Petite Sirah (Central Coast)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A severity of tannin and heat opens this wine before mellowing into soft, juicy red raspberry and plum. Remaining relatively light bodied and restrained for the variety, it becomes softer on the chocolaty midpalate before a grippy finish grabs back the power.
Name: Byington 2013 Smith Vineyards Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine doesn't try to conceal what it is, a 100% varietal exploration of a hearty grape, though in this case, from a relatively cool area. Black-purple in color, it offers structure and tension atop developed flavors of mocha chocolate and plum.
Name: Bluenose 2012 Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A small addition of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot don't rein in any of this wine's significant power, highlighted in plummy licorice and inviting aromas of chocolate that mellow on the palate, revealing a thick and rich explosion of ripeness with a concentrated finish.
Name: Raymond 2013 Small Lot Collection Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a mild-mannered, softly one-dimensional version of the variety, robust in chocolate mocha and blueberry jam that finishes easily.
Name: Wilson 2011 Ellie's Vineyard Estate Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: There's a middle-of-the-road softness to this wine, which attempts to conjure elements of feral blackberry and blueberry, but falls flat in the middle.
Name: Madrigal 2012 Barberis Family Reserve Petite Sirah (Calistoga)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A blueberry-balsamic reduction sauce scent kicks off this rich and opulent wine from the legendary Hearst family. It also shows smoked beef, uncracked peppercorns, black spices, vanilla bean and black coffee on the nose. The palate is lush and layered with blueberry paste, dark-chocolate fudge and Ethiopian espresso bean.
Name: Hearst Ranch 2013 The Pergola Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Thick and viscous in the glass, this densely loaded wine shows buttery, vanilla-laced French toast on the nose as well as black cherry, blackberry, crushed lavender and marjoram notes. The round palate is relatively tight with elderberry, espresso and black-peppercorn flavors, lifted elegantly by purple flowers.
Name: ONX 2013 Black Orchid Petite Sirah (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Description: From a consistently fine producer of the variety, this classic version is blended with 15% other varieties and aged for a year in entirely American oak, 25% of it new. Viscous and black in color, it's surprisingly vibrant on the palate, offering just-ripe blackberry and mocha around a cradle of nuanced acidity and peppery spice.
Name: Stags' Leap Winery 2012 Ne Cede Malis Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Stags Leap District)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine was given two-and-a-half years in barrel, the majority of it new American oak. Smoky in character, it has a compressed and extracted feel, built around sizable punches of black plum, cedar, earth and coffee. It's big, but good.
Name: Prager 2010 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pitch-black in the glass, this is a meaty, deep wine, with inviting aromas of beef, black currant, caramel and smoke on the nose. The acidity is quite explosive on the palate, where flavors of charred beef, plum sauce, peppercorns and blueberry migrate towards a dark-roasted coffee note.
Name: Dunning Vineyards 2012 Reserve Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine opens in a reduced way, with plenty of barrel influence apparent. It develops in the glass into a mix of chalky tannin and red and blue fruit, with accents of black licorice and white chocolate. Aged in new French, American and European oak, it has a tannic finish that should benefit with time. Drink now through 2021.
Name: Trentadue 2013 La Storia Estate Bottled Petite Sirah (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black pepper, lavender, blueberry, blackcurrant, grapseseed and smoked game make for a heady nose on this wine from a property just south of the Sana Ynez River. The palate offers tart black fruit and elderberry jam, with just enough pepper and purple flowers to round out the sip.
Name: Refugio Ranch 2013 Petite Sirah (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine is a nice one, approachable and interesting in baked plum, licorice and leather. Tannins are sizable yet integrated.
Name: Miro 2013 Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blackberry, violet and ash aromas rise toward a light vanilla and fudge profile on the nose of this bottling. The tannins are prominent on the tip of the sip, followed by raging acidity. Next juicy flavors of black fruit pleasingly commence, accented by purple flowers, white pepper and cocoa powder.
Name: Le Vigne 2013 Di Ranchita Vista Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an approachable, soft and relatively light-bodied version of the variety, tamed for present-day consumption and enjoyment. Chocolate-covered blueberries and maple syrup provide decadence, brightened by the presence of kirsch.
Name: Francis Ford Coppola 2012 Reserve Petite Sirah (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Compressed and concentrated in juicy black fruit, this vineyard-designate is soft and powerful. Most of all it reveals a powerful ripeness of blueberry jam, washed down with coffee.
Name: Miro 2013 Coyote Ridge Vineyard Reserve Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A bit shy on the nose compared to other Petite Sirahs, this bottling shows concentrated blueberry fruit, black pepper, tart plum skin and a touch of wet asphalt. Dense lavender and more blueberry fruit consume the palate, where chunky tannins pack in charred meat and purple fruit tones, finishing on a touch of vanilla.
Name: Ancient Peaks 2012 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Vanilla, clove, allspice, dried ginger and soy are laced into black-plum sauce on the nose of this densely layered wine. The palate is even-handed, with tight boysenberry spiced up by caramel and bitter espresso notes.
Name: Opaque 2012 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: A plethora of smoke and dried tobacco unveils a rustic quality to this estate-grown wine, big in tannin and somewhat diluted in fruit.
Name: Madrigal 2012 Estate Petite Sirah (Calistoga)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Soft and approachable, this full-bodied wine features classic elements of blueberry, blackberry and leathery chocolate that finish without much ado.
Name: Puccioni 2012 Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Dusty blueberry and chocolate provide heftiness to this full-bodied, densely concentrated wine, which ends simply and without much fanfare.
Name: Madrigal 2012 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Almost jet black, this wine is nonetheless quite thin in flavor. The color extraction and substantial alcohol do not translate to ripe, fleshy fruit. Hints of berry and cracker quickly vanish.
Name: Agate Ridge 2010 Petite Sirah (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this bottling is quite complex and alluring, with an array of herbs—thyme, rosemary, lavender and other purple flowers—set against fire-roasted plum fruit. Slightly lighter than other Petite Sirahs, the palate offers flavors of mulberry, boysenberry, baked fennel, black pepper and beef roast.
Name: Clavo Cellars 2011 Dreamer Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The power of smoky oak shows strongly on this wine. Black-cherry fruit aromas are woven in with caramel, fudge, vanilla and cappuccino scents. A strong tannic structure frames the palate, with juicy black-cherry and blueberry flavors enhanced with milk chocolate and more caramel. Drink 2017–2033.
Name: J. Lohr 2013 Tower Road Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: This is an aromatic brooder with aromas of scorched earth, plum, dried flowers and green herbs. It's full in feel with dense, dark-fruit flavors, tightly coiled tannins and tart acids—a pleasing example of the variety.
Name: Huston 2012 Private Reserve Petite Sirah

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling, which is leveled a bit by the inclusion of 13% Zinfandel and 12% Grenache, shows blackberry jam, black cherry and concentrated lilac aromas on the nose. The palate is nicely layered with just enough tannic structure for optimal drinking now, combining flavors of blueberry and black cherry with caramel, milk chocolate and plum-skin tartness.
Name: Proulx 2013 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tar and slightly sour black-fruit aromas show on the nose of this brooding bottling, which also has dried plum-skin qualities. Blackberry and blueberry fruits show powerfully on the palate, alongside dark chocolate and smoked-meat flavors, all tied together with a hickory-wood element.
Name: Vina Robles 2012 Estate Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Temecula, South Coast, California, US
Description: There's a feral quality to the nose of this wine, with wet hay and grapeseed aromas alongside black-cherry fruit. A punchy plum flavor shows on the palate, as does dried oregano and more barnyard qualities.
Name: Danza del Sol 2012 Petite Sirah (Temecula)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Opaque and inky with shades of purple and black, this dessert wine smells both fresh and dense with blackberry, blueberry and gravel notes. The palate packs ripe blueberry and black-cherry-paste flavors with grippy plum-skin texture and a touch of espresso, proving quite sweet but complex.
Name: Chronic Cellars NV Tranquilo Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This engaging, multilayered, flavorful and nuanced wine has subtle aromas like black pepper and grilled meat. Flavors suggest ripe Bing cherries and blackberries, while the seductive mouthfeel is rich and velvety. Aged 20 months in American oak barrels, the wine has great structure and will improve through at least 2020.
Name: Ruby Hill Winery 2012 Reserve Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: An stunning wine, this has enticing, complex aromas like black peppercorns, grilled beef, licorice and blackberries, with similarly layered flavors and a great sense of richness and depth. Full bodied and bold, it's packed with velvety tannins, yet finishes with elegant polish.
Name: High Valley Vineyard 2011 Petite Sirah (High Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very dark, very full bodied and very flavorful, this dry wine combines aromas like blackberry jam and blueberry syrup, a rounded mouthfeel in spite of assertive tannins, and a lingering fruity finish. It will taste great now with big, meaty dishes, and is sure to improve through at least 2020.
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2012 Fox Creek Petite Sirah (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Battalion­s of tannin accompany ripe fruit flavors in this bold, full-bodied wine made from Petite Sirah and Petit Verdot. A supportive wrap of astringency from layers of fine tannin bolsters the rich blackberry and blueberry flavors, while flashy, spicy, smoky, new-oak accents infuse everything from the aroma to the finish.
Name: Michael David 2013 Petite Petit Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Big, robust and powerful, this inky wine has wonderfully complex and assertive flavors, along with a thick, velvety and tannic texture. Flavors of espresso, dark chocolate and blueberries rush across the palate, linger in the chewy texture and last on the long finish. A bit bold to fully enjoy now, this will be best after 2019.
Name: Klinker Brick 2013 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From the winery that first popularized Petite Sirah in California, this vintage has vivid black-pepper aromas and a deep, inky color. Rich and concentrated flavors suggest pomegranate juice, blackberries and clove. Lavish and layered tannins give the texture an almost thick viscosity that coats the mouth for a lasting impression.
Name: Concannon 2010 Reserve Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Drenched with dark and rich fruit flavors as well as velvety and thick tannins, this is a bold and mouth-coating wine that still carries off a bit of polish. A hint of sweetness helps the immense structure soften around the edges and lets dark chocolate and cassis liqueur flavors come through. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Shannon Ridge 2013 High Elevation Collection Petite Sirah (Lake County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The color is almost black, and lots of dark berry and black pepper aromas come out. This wine's flavors are even more pronounced, tasting peppery, meaty and like boysenberries. Dense ­tannins make the mouthfeel thick and layered. A lingering finish attests to its considerable concentration.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2013 Petite Sirah (Amador County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From a notoriously tannic grape variety comes this well-polished yet massively concentrated wine. Gorgeous, softly ripe berry and black-fig flavors demand attention from the first whiff to the lingering finish. Delicious to drink now with meat or game, it will age well through at least 2020.
Name: Las Positas 2012 Estate Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A tower of tannin shapes this deep-colored and ripely fruity wine into an awesome drink. Layers of fine tannins pile up to make a firm, thick texture that supports lots of deep berry flavors and cleans the palate as you sip. It will make a good match with grilled and roasted beef, lamb or game.
Name: Bogle 2013 Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Intense and concentrated blackberry flavors rise above thick tannins in this full-bodied wine. Aromas suggest boysenberry, smoke and clove, while the flavors taste more like blackberry jam. Although the texture is dense and tannic, it stays velvety rather than drying. This will be great now with ribs or roast venison, but will easily age through 2020.
Name: Ironstone 2014 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This delicious, dark, full-bodied wine smells like blackberry jam and tastes like blueberries and dark chocolate. It has a richly tannic but not harsh texture and lingering finish. The gorgeous fruit flavors make it drinkable now, but it will mature nicely through 2020.
Name: Twisted Twig 2011 Regal Petite Sirah (El Dorado County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: In color, this wine is virtually black, with a deep-red rim, while aromas are concentrated and dense. Flavors recall blackberry syrup, yet are nicely dry. Despite its full body and thick coating of tannins, the wine's texture feels polished and all the elements are in balance.
Name: McManis 2014 Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine smells like toasted bread, salt and black pepper, and tastes like a grilled steak, with smoke and blackberry accents. The tannin meter goes high, as the varietal's notorious thick texture and controlled astringency show through. Best to hold this and drink after 2019.
Name: Perry Creek 2011 Altitude 2401 Fair Play Farms Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Packed with delicious, ripe blackberry and blueberry flavors, this is a concentrated and full-bodied wine, with fine-grained tannins. Very tasty now with fatty cheeses and meats, it will improve through at least 2020.
Name: Guenoc 2013 Petite Sirah (Lake County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Huge in structure and monolithic in flavor, this young, rough-cut wine will need until at least 2020 to show its best stuff. This variety is known for aging well, so it's not much of a gamble. The color is black with a dark, smoky rim, the aromas are like charcoal and blackberry jam, and the flavors seem saturated with fine tannins.
Name: Barra of Mendocino 2011 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Mendocino)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Almost black in color, this full-bodied wine is bold in aroma, smelling like black pepper and blackberry, with a slightly earthy edge. It tastes dense, rich but dry. A thick coat of tannins leads to an astringent finish.
Name: Steiner Family Vineyards 2012 Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This big, imposing wine seems like it is so packed with flavor and tannins that it hasn't sorted itself out yet and needs time to come into balance. It has aromas like clove, tar and beef broth, and thick smoky, beefy flavors. The color is dark. Best drink this after 2018.
Name: Vinum 2014 Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Bright cherry and raspberry flavors and a smooth texture make this wine stand out. Aromas are a bit earthy, mature but slightly floral, and the flavors resemble blackberry jam. While full bodied, it's not very tannic and has an unsually soft mouthfeel for this varietal.
Name: Ripken 2013 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: This is a no-nonsense, straightforward wine with a very deep color, blackberry aromas and roast coffee flavors. Huge tannins that make the texture drying and astringent. Time will mellow it, so it's best not to drink until at least 2019.
Name: Two Angels 2013 Petite Sirah (Red Hills)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Herbal, earthy and anise-like aromas and juicy, dark berry flavors give this medium-bodied wine a rustic appeal. It has deep, dark color and plenty of tannin, yet it's more easygoing than many of its peers.
Name: Line 39 2013 Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine has candied fruit aromas and flavors, plus heat in the aroma and in the mouth.
Name: Naggiar 2012 Estate Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Intense color, intense hot aromas and intense blackberry-jam flavors make this an extreme, full-bodied wine. It has plenty of tannins and an overtone of heat in the aroma and the finish.
Name: Wargin Wines 2012 Granite Hill Vineyards Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a pretty wine, vibrant in white pepper and braised meat. The nose is pure violet and blueberry, while the approach to the fruit is light-handed, with integrated tannins and a low oak imprint. Entirely varietal, it delves into earthy territory with elements of forest floor and dark chocolate.
Name: Gustafson Family 2011 East Ridge Vineyard Estate Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Rutherford, Napa, California, US
Description: Wound tightly, this burly, brawny bruiser comes out of its shell slowly to reveal soft, perfumy notes of violet and blueberry. Flavors of dark chocolate and jam sit atop powerfully rich, dense pockets of leather and black pepper. Drink now through 2023.
Name: Robert Biale 2013 Royal Punishers Petite Sirah (Rutherford)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black pepper, blackberry and beef char give a savory style to this bottling, which also has lighter touches of violets and other purple flowers. The palate shows espresso laid across ripe blueberry fruit that carries through the sip, framed by strong but judicious tannins, and spiced with a dill-tarragon character.
Name: Proulx 2013 Petite Sirah (Central Coast)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Violets and white pepper intrude pleasantly on the nose of this estate-grown wine, accented by 10% Zinfandel. Layered and mischievously elegant despite its size, it's drinkable now, as satisfying as a piece of blueberry pie, and yet structured. It's a fine wine to lie down, through 2022.
Name: Gustafson Family 2012 East Ridge Vineyard Estate Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tar and dense black currant fruit lie at the core of this wine's nose, with a light raspberry tone on the edges, along with aromas of iced coffee and pressed violets. Soft blueberry and olallieberry flavors sit at the tip of the palate, which gets thicker, toward espresso ice cream and fudge.
Name: Pianetta 2013 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black as night in the glass, this wine shows black cherries, lava rocks and espresso beans on the dense nose. It's thick and chewy once sipped, with zesty acidity that sizzles across the palate, showing blackberry and coffee flavors. It's all power, with very little finesse. Sales of the wine benefit multiple sclerosis research.
Name: Counter Punch 2013 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: An inky-black, syrupy-thick wine from 60-year-old head-trained vines, this fills the palate with a taste of blueberry cobbler aside a slab of bacon, a mix of both savory and sweet. Rich and ripe, it finishes awash in strong black coffee, ready to stow away in the cellar through 2020.
Name: Varozza 2010 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (St. Helena)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh-pressed blackberry aromas leap out of the glass of this wine, along with asphalt and a touch of purple flowers. The palate is a study of density and thickness, with black plums, coffee and espresso showing most out of the deep, black flavors.
Name: Siot 2013 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Showing earthy aromas, very full body and impressive tannins, this wine has flavors full of smoke, black pepper and blackberry. The thick, dry texture coats the mouth with tannin and dark color. It's a big wine, and should taste great with dishes like slow-cooked ribs.
Name: Parducci 2012 True Grit Reserve Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Given four years in 100% new French oak and another year in bottle, this is a blockbuster of a wine. It's huge in every way, from its intensity of coconut, vanilla and milk chocolate to its dense, chalky tannins. It may need time to come around, its sheer weight impressively wrapped in blackberry and blueberry jam.
Name: Eighty Four 2009 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This has a lively, albeit unconventional entry, with aromatics conjuring up gingersnap cookies. Coffee, blackberry and a potent whiff of barnyard take over, the earthy flavors muting the fruit.
Name: Folin Cellars 2012 Petite Sirah (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Made from 100% varietal grapes, this vineyard-designate offers minty eucalyptus and leather in a medium- to light-bodied package, with streaky tannins and low oak. The fruit is elusive behind the savory meat and flinty gunpowder.
Name: Archival 2013 Juliana Vineyard Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated but fresh aromas of black cherries and blueberries mesh with hot black gravel and nose-tickling lilacs on this wine by the Fess Parker family. Dark chocolate, peppery spice, black cherry syrup and mocha flavors shine on the robust, rich and delicious palate.
Name: Epiphany 2012 Rodney's Vineyard Petite Sirah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely spicy on the nose, with clove, black cardamom, gingerbread and more baking spice, this bottling also shows aromas of concentrated hibiscus, soy sauce and beef teriyaki. A black-rock minerality powers the palate, alongside buttered cherries, charred beef, pipe smoke, fudge and lifting menthol flavors.
Name: Le Vigne 2012 Di Ranchito Vista Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: There is nothing petite about this wine. It shows an opaque red-black color, concentrated aromas full of blackberry and cedar, then flavors like pomegranate juice and blackberry jam, without being sweet. All this density and intensity will help it age. It will improve if allowed to age in a cool place until at least 2020.
Name: Edmeades 2012 Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine pumps up the jammy fruit flavors of the grape variety. It packs in the typical thick but fine tannins, and also contributes spicy complexities like cardamom and black pepper that lend it an extra dimension. The oak flavors seem very intense but there is so much grapy richness that the wine remains powerfully balanced. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Klinker Brick 2012 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: San Antonio Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: As a counterpoint to fruit-driven takes on this historic California grape, this bottling shows the variety's shrubby side, with aromas of wild peppercorns, woody elderberries and olallieberries. Flavors are extremely earthy and restrained, with oregano, thyme and incense, proving quite elegant and never boisterous.
Name: Santa Cruz Mountain Vineyard 2012 Pierce Ranch Petite Sirah (San Antonio Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An exuberant boysenberry jam aroma and richly layered berry and dark chocolate flavors give lots of taste pleasure to this full-bodied and impressively textured wine. It's a monster in terms of tannin and impact on the taste buds, but not over the top in alcohol. Best to drink from 2018 to 2025.
Name: Naggiar 2011 Estate Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Produced by the Terravant facility in Buellton, this shows lots of smoked pork and bacon fat against a boysenberry-fruit frame on the nose. Flavors are quite sanguine, with iron and blood elements, as well as more smoke and some dried herbs.
Name: Tines 2013 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried red cherries and lighter cranberries mix with black slate on the nose of this wine from a longtime regional label, now owned by Bill Foley. The palate shows lots of iron and bloody meats, along with dried cranberries and elderberries.
Name: EOS 2013 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Meaty, smoky flavors mark this dark and full-bodied wine, adding a layer of interest to the ripe blackberry and black-pepper notes underneath. The color is extremely dense and the tannic texture stops just short of extreme.
Name: Rosenblum 2011 Heritage Clones Petite Sirah (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried black fruits, cedar, tobacco and just a few dried purple flowers show on this wine's slightly sour nose. The palate is a bit flat, with purple berries, tar and tobacco flavors that come and go quickly.
Name: EOS 2012 Brohaugh Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Valle de Guadalupe, Mexico
Description: This purple-tinted heavyweight smells rugged, scratchy and jammy, with horsey notes accenting currant and cranberry flavors. An aggressive palate is far from an easy ride, while plum, spice and herbal flavors end with juicy acidity.
Name: L.A. Cetto 2012 Estate Bottled Petite Sirah (Valle de Guadalupe)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Dense and intense, with loads of fine-grained tannin, this is a deep, dark-colored wine with oodles of flavor and a very thick texture. As massive as it is in texture though, delicious flavors like blackberry, blueberry and dark chocolate come through and then linger on the finish. Drink from 2016 to 2026.
Name: Cedarville 2012 Naylor Vineyard Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Intensely aromatic, this is a spicy, sublime and soft wine, elegant and unexpected, bright and alive and fresh instead of overbearing. Its rustic roots endear rather than distract, with an exuberance of blueberry at its core.
Name: Madrigal 2011 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Black and inky, with a tease of rustic, leathery earth, this is a smooth, easygoing version of the variety, rich in baked red fruit and plum. The finish combines for a developed, complex notion of both powerful tannin and high-toned elegance, finding a balance within itself that begs for further aging. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Carlisle 2013 Palisades Vineyard Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: The winery's larger bottling of the variety, one it has mastered for decades, this wine is a mix of baked plum and rustic leather notes. It's softly tannic, with pronounced jolts of tobacco and black pepper. With small amounts of other Rhône varieties, from Syrah to Viognier, it meanders to the finish, with a distinct trace of minerality.
Name: Stags' Leap Winery 2012 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Complex tannins confound the palate at first, but mellow on the back side, inviting gregarious amounts of leather, black pepper and blackberry, a waft of cigar smoke in the mix, too. Fuller-bodied in style, the wine will benefit from time; cellar through 2020.
Name: Keating 2012 Petite Sirah (Rockpile)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine is elegant in violet and lavender aromas. There is a softness to the palate that's inviting, built around vibrant layers of blueberry and a hint of leather. The presence of oak is refreshingly low, allowing the chocolate and caramel finish to shine.
Name: Clif Family 2012 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a brooder, with aromas of violets and purple fruit. It's full bodied with dense fruit flavors, citrusy acids and firm tannins—a delicious example of the variety.
Name: Covington 2011 Olsen Vineyard Petite Sirah (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Perfumed, soft, smooth and elegant, this 100% varietal wine is not overly oaken nor overly tannic, a surprising twist on type. Plum and blackberry weave through a medium build and easygoing finish.
Name: Collier Falls 2011 Hillside Estate Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: In this wine aged 26 months in new and used American oak, the barrel aromas show themselves first, with notes of vanilla and coffee followed by spice and dark fruit. The coffee and cherry flavors are medium bodied, with well-integrated tannins backing them up.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 2012 Zephyr Ridge Petite Sirah (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This vineyard-designate, 100% varietal is dense in tobacco and a distinction of black pepper, the fruit subdued behind a wall of leathery tannins. Let it open and enjoy with brisket or cassoulet.
Name: Ty Caton 2012 Caton Vineyard Petite Sirah (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Overflowing with blackberry and black pepper flavors, this affordable, rich and layered wine is very dark in color, saturated with firm tannins and full in body. Serve with some hefty protein to make a good match.
Name: Ravenswood 2013 Vintners Blend Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine is soft in jammy black fruit, with back notes of black pepper and smoke. From the warmer part of the Napa Valley in a warm vintage, it's big and powerful.
Name: Envy 2012 Estate Petite Sirah (Calistoga)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Muted aromatics frame the entry of this wine, a concentration of baked raspberry and blackberry at its core. Smooth and soft, with minimal presence of oak, it's a fairly elegant expression of the grape.
Name: Graton Ridge 2013 Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: Brawny in blackberry, blueberry and black pepper, with a shake of cinnamon, this is a soft, complex wine with leathery undertones. From steep, volcanic-soiled vines, it's appropriately tannic without being overbearing.
Name: Summit Lake 2010 Sophia Lynn Estate Petite Sirah (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Knights Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine from a warm region in a warm year, this discloses a thick, rich and syrupy aspect to the layers of soft tannin and dense blackberry fruit. It calls for pairing with meaty dishes.
Name: Summers 2012 Petite Sirah (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Don't let the cartoony label fool you, this is fantastic wine. The color is almost black to the rim, the aromas are meaty and peppery, and the flavors are very concentrated. The texture is thick and yet creamy with layered, smooth and bold tannins. For all its density and depth, however, this is not an overpowering monster. The blackberry and black pepper notes are rich and appealing and everything seems in balance for something this robust and full bodied. Drink now through 2027. It's blended with 15% Petit Verdot.
Name: Michael David 2012 Petite Petit Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Description: This classic offering combines Petite Sirah with Carignane, Grenache, Syrah, Peloursin and Mourvèdre. Truffled earth and black pepper give it a savory edge that's completely inviting, while the mouthfeel remains soft despite the powerful tannins. Enjoyable now, it should disclose a depth of complexity over time; cellar through 2021.
Name: Stags' Leap Winery 2011 Ne Cede Malis Petite Sirah (Stags Leap District)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A pretty bouquet of violets greets the nose, followed by a bolt of black pepper. Boysenberry, black cherry and leather combine to mark the palate, which also reveals cola and anise. Soft and restrained for the variety, this is a food-friendly wine, with a gnarled bite of tannin on the finish.
Name: Armida 2012 Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Leather and cigar box rise to the fore of this smoky wine, accented in coconut, black pepper and cedar. Dusty on the palate, it hails from a Calistoga-based vineyard site, prime location for the variety. It becomes more intense in black pepper and brambly blackberry and plum as it finishes, lean enough to invite more sips.
Name: Grgich Hills 2010 Miljenko's Vineyard Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Sweet and spicy oak aromas and flavors throw a tasty coating on the robust berry and smoked meat impressions underneath. This wine is quite tannic, full bodied and almost drying on the finish, needing a juicy chunk of beef or rack of pork ribs to tame it down.
Name: Naggiar 2011 Estate La Bête Noir Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Despite the relatively high alcohol and scents of slightly cooked, raisined fruit, this comes across as rather thin and stiff. The fruit lacks any sweetness, and the tannins turn chalky in the finish.
Name: Plaisance Ranch 2012 Petite Sirah (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: Dark and jammy on the nose, the palate brings bouncy blackberry and blueberry-sauce flavors. Textured black pepper notes lead to the finish on this medium-bodied, medium-tannin wine.
Name: Creekside Cellars 2012 Petite Sirah (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A signature variety for this winery, this bottling includes 20% Syrah. It offers appealing aromas of jammy blue fruit, dried herbs and milk chocolate. It's high octane ,with sweet barrel notes and chewy tannins.
Name: Dusted Valley 2012 Stone Tree Petite Sirah (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Galilee, Israel
Description: With aromas of strawberry and blueberry, this wine is tart at first sip, but then opens to rich flavors of slightly savory black cherry, strawberry, thyme and aniseed.
Name: Recanati 2013 Reserve Petite Sirah (Galilee)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blackberry-laced chocolate syrup, black cherry extract, freshly tanned leather and sweet tobacco leaf join forces to power a remarkable wine from this winery near San Miguel, where the owning family first planted vines in 1997. The palate shows black olives, leather, tobacco, clove, black cardamom and dried black cherries, all held together by solid tannic grip.
Name: Pianetta 2012 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Welsh winemaker Damian Grindley has turned out a winner from north of his Paso Robles winery. Aromas of black cherry, toasted vanilla, fudge and cigar ash lead into a palate that's juicy and jammy with black fruits at first, but then edged with dark flavors of coffee grinds and charred meat.
Name: Brecon Estate 2013 Petite Sirah (Monterey)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Not a shy wine, this looks very dark and smells smoky and meaty. It tastes extra ripe and rich, showing off both the grapes and the sweet-seeming oak with which the wine was apparently aged. There is a strong maple syrup and smoked bacon flavor, a thick, tongue-coating texture and lingering finish.
Designation: Casa de Vinas Long Row Heine
Name: Vasco Urbano 2012 Casa de Vinas Long Row Heine Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lavish aromas of black cherry, blackberry jam, gingerbread, mincemeat pie and caramel chews combine for a hedonistic nose on this wine from Aaron Jackson. Dense, dark blueberry fruit drives the palate, which gains complexity from espresso beans, dark chocolate and graphite minerality.
Name: Aaron 2012 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A really tasty example of the varietal, this has fresh, pure, jammy aromas, abundant fruit flavors and equally abundant tannins. With little evidence of oak, it is a robust, uncomplicated wine that will taste great now with steak or ribs, and may well improve with age through about 2020.
Name: Garré 2011 Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The aromas of boysenberry, black pepper and roasting game are reminiscent of Syrah in this tasty bottling from brother-vintners David and William Vondrasek. The palate offers a lot of zing, followed by flavors of tobacco ash, olallieberry and peppery bacon.
Name: Artisan Uprising 2012 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a fruit bomb supreme. Bright, effusive strawberry, raspberry and boysenberry aromas and flavors seem to spread out in all directions, first in the aroma, then repeating in the flavors and finish. With a sip or two some deeper black cherry notes emerge, and full body and gripping tannins become more apparent.
Name: Peltier 2013 Hybrid Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: San Francisco Bay, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The winery behind America's first Petite Sirah continues pumping out quaffable bottles, including this show of black plums, pressed violets, black raspberries, white pepper, licorice candy and dill on the nose. The palate offers boysenberries and baked oregano, with a tapenade-like zing on the finish.
Name: Concannon 2013 Petite Sirah (San Francisco Bay)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Violet, lavender, espresso and cherry-cola syrup aromas show on the nose of this wine by interior designer Caren Rideau and industry veteran Andres Ibarra, who's been growing and making wine for decades. The palate offers blueberry, cedar ash and pencil shavings, but it shows quite a bit of grip and will require more patience to enjoy fully.
Name: Ibarra 2010 La Presa Vineyard Petite Sirah (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Once past an element of burnt rubber that mingles with the ripe blackberry aromas, this becomes a hearty and concentrated wine yet one with very moderate alcohol. It has plenty of tannins to add texture, and enough concentration to keep the vivid berry and wood smoke flavors lingering on the finish. It's made without adding sulfites.
Name: Frey 2013 Organic Petite Sirah (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A vanilla bean element leads the nose on this wine, with cherry, olallieberry and caramel syrup coming in as well. The palate isn't quite so delicious, with the vanilla flavors remaining alongside woody elements, purple fruits and black olives.
Name: Clavo Cellars 2010 Dreamer Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A smoky, slightly rubbery aroma is off-putting at first, until the black pepper and dense fruit flavors kick in on the palate. This is light to medium bodied, yet packed tightly with astringent tannins.
Name: Frey 2013 Estate Grown Biodynamic Petite Sirah (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine delivers aromas of molten-lava chocolate cake with black cherry syrup and a mint leaf on top. The palate shows bacon fat, blackberry extract, dark chocolate and freshly ground espresso, with a peppery roast-beef crust on the finish. It's a touch hot, but the wondrous flavors are worth it.
Name: Ancient Peaks 2011 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose lures one in with very approachable aromas of black pepper, bacon fat, blackberry, anise and toasted chia seeds. The licorice quality powers the palate as well, further made delicious by black cherries, blueberries and game. The tannic grip is a bit firm right now, so wait until mid-2016.
Name: Refugio Ranch 2012 Petite Sirah (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aged in a mix of French, American and Hungarian oak barrels for 16 months, this wine presents white pepper, blueberry extract and sweet mint on the nose. Firm tannins and a strong acidity allow the blueberry flavors to dance across the tongue, with chocolate and espresso in the midpalate and finish.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2012 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Giant waves of blackberry and burly oak provide a density and richness on the palate, accented by barrel vanilla, mocha and cigar. Not for the faint of heart, it should be enjoyed with big food and bigger friends.
Name: Truett Hurst 2012 Burning Man Old Vine Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dark and inky, this wine is made from a small vineyard on the western slopes of its appellation, planted entirely to the variety. Juicy blackberry and black plum play off of milk chocolate and vanilla, the tannins still teeth-staining, though the oak remains well-integrated and the texture soft.
Name: Shippey 2012 Flaming J Vineyard Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ian Brand's stab at this grape shows a lot of black rock minerality and bloody meats on the nose, layered across blueberry syrup and sour cherry elements. The palate is much lighter than other takes on this varietal, showing menthol-laced flavors of blackberries and tobacco.
Name: Le P'tit Paysan 2012 Petite Sirah (Monterey County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a slightly reductive quality on the nose of this wine, with rubber, tar, dill and hot lava rock notes. The palate shows roast beef char, sour cherry fruits and asphalt.
Name: Consilience 2012 Petite Sirah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black as night in the glass and noticeably viscous, this shows brooding aromas of heavy char, black tobacco, cassis, bloody meat and balsamic vinegar. The palate isn't so heavy, though. Good acidity and tannins glide across the tongue while offering flavors of pencil lead, black cherry extract and black pepper.
Name: Aver Family Vineyards 2011 Blessings Petite Sirah (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Made by a fascinating family that moved over the generations from France to Hawaii and South Dakota before settling on the Central Coast, this is an incredibly inky and powerful wine. Aromas of blackberry extract and blueberry syrup mix with granite, graphite, lava rock and menthol. The mouthfeel is luxurious, the acidity strong and lasting, and the flavors dominated by purple fruits and spicy peppers. It doesn't taste as hot as it is.
Name: Dubost 2012 Worth Hill Vineyard Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine from the well-known Los Alamos Valley vineyard shows aromas of licorice, blackberry extract, peppery plums, chewy berry candies and mint. It's full on the palate at first, but stay afloat on the tongue with tar, more blackberries and chopped Italian herbs. The tannins could use a bit more mellowing.
Name: Jaffurs 2012 Thompson Vineyard Petite Sirah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh squeezed blackberries, black pepper and fragrant purple flowers hit the nose on this wine that spent 30 months in French, Hungarian and American oak. Flavors of balsamic reduction arise on the palate, with more blackberry and some oregano. The tannins could use a tad more mellowing.
Name: Monte De Oro 2011 Estate Petite Sirah (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is 100% varietal, featuring light and appealing notes of herbs, freshly tilled soil, purple fruit and violets along with high-toned barrel spices. It's full bodied yet remains elegant with abundant cherry flavors accented by peppery spices backed by a firm squeeze of tannins and tart acids—a high-quality example of the variety. It needs food to truly shine.
Name: Northwest Cellars 2011 Art Den Hoed Vineyard Petite Sirah (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: This 100% varietal provides a pretty example of Petite Sirah, with appealing accents of dark coffee and plum. The soft, supple feel to the fruit flavors belies the firm tannins at this wine's core. Amaro-like bitters on the finish are the only thing that holds this wine back from reaching further heights.
Name: Sawtooth 2011 Trout Trilogy Petite Sirah

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Made from fruit off of the Cira and Shoemaker vineyards on Paso's Eastside, this hits the nose with pipe tobacco, plums and licorice, with a nice stony minerality too. It's quite restrained for a bombastic grape, with olallieberry, crushed herbs and a steady focus on black rocks. The tannins are present but not overdone.
Name: Tower 15 2012 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Wood takes center stage on this wine. Char, dark roasted coffee, chocolate and vanilla are followed by sweet fruit and oak flavors backed by firm, dry tannins.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 2011 Reserve Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Petite Sirah (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: Unusual notes suggest cherry, allspice and hickory smoke. It's full bodied with cherry flavors and firm tannins that lead to a mesquite-filled finish.
Name: Fujishin 2012 Reserve Petite Sirah

Appellation: Samson, Israel
Description: Dark violet-red in color, this wine has aromas of black cherry, lavender and confectioner's sugar. Cool and bright notes play off each other, with flavors of ripe black cherry, anisette, cranberry and sage. Soft tannins lead to a finish that is long-lasting but doesn't overstay its welcome.
Name: Dalton 2012 Oak Aged Petite Sirah (Samson)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: It's rare to find this variety in Pinot-heavy Russian River Valley, but this producer treats it with respect, crafting a minuscule amount of worthy flavor, the 100% Petite Sirah awash in velvety tannins that tease in coconut and vanilla. Soft oak is supported by smoky leather, chocolate and blackberry, a dustiness completing the picture.
Name: Fulcrum 2012 Landy Vineyard Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Ample ripe fruit characterizes this bottling, a limited selection of which was made from sustainably farmed and estate-grown grapes. Soft layers of substantial tannins rally around blueberry and blackberry fruit that's got some heat and smoke, suggesting barbecue as the right pairing call.
Name: Kunde 2011 Petite Sirah (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Accented by 8% Zinfandel and 2% Syrah, this is big in robust, juicy black cherry and oak, the tannins correspondingly dusty and sizable. On the soft finish, a cup of drip black coffee suggests itself.
Name: Girard 2012 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Petite Sirah remains a curiosity in Oregon, and at such a low level of ripeness, this turns generic. Tart cranberry fruit remains herbal and thin as it hits a quick finish. The wine is well made, but lacks varietal punch and authenticity.
Name: Folin Cellars 2011 Petite Sirah (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This has a very deep color, even for this notoriously dark varietal. Complex aromas blend rich fruit with smoky, peppery notes, followed by mouthcoating flavors like dark-chocolate-covered blackberries. It doesn't mess around with overtly sweet oak, but stays dry, concentrated and focused. Best after 2020.
Name: Aratás 2010 Shake Ridge Petite Sirah (Amador County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Big, but nicely proportioned and balanced, this dark, spicy, rich, dry wine makes the mouth water for a slab of grilled meat. It has ripe blackberry, espresso and mild smoky flavors, surprisingly smooth tannins and a lingering finish.
Name: Shannon Ridge 2012 High Elevation Petite Sirah (Lake County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is complex, delicious, bold and tannic, bringing the big structure that is expected without being heavy handed. It offers concentrated blackberry and fig aromas, richly jammy flavors that stay dry and a tannic but not tough texture.
Name: Concannon 2010 Conservancy Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a gutsy wine, with firm tannins, making the texture slightly astringent while tightly holding in the fruit and oak flavors. It needs rich food alongside, or hold it until 2017 to mellow.
Name: Ironstone 2013 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: It smells like a nicely charred steak and tastes like black pepper, dark chocolate, and boysenberry. It has plenty of oak in the aroma and flavors, but enough fruit, tannins and rich mouthfeel to balance it out.
Name: Vinum 2012 Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This rich, earthy, concentrated wine offers lots of ripe fruit flavor cloaked in velvety tannins. It smells like black cherries and black pepper, tastes like pomegranate and espresso and has a dense mouth feel, full body and lingering finish.
Name: Drytown 2011 Estate Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very impressive color, fruit concentration and tannic structure add up to an outstanding Petite Sirah. What's compelling is that this full-bodied wine seems to get its character purely from the concentrated and tannin-laden grapes rather than from new oak barrels or add-ins. This needs time in a cool cellar to show all its potential complexity. Best from 2016–2022.
Name: Helwig 2012 Petite Sirah (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A deep, dark color combines with extravagantly spicy oak aromas, rich fruit flavors and layers of fine tannins for a show-stopping performance. This is full-bodied and firm in texture, abundantly laced with blackberry and boysenberry flavors and pretty much irresistible. Drink now or cellar through 2018.
Name: Michael David 2012 Earthquake Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Complex aromas of stewed cherries, peppercorns and burned toast abound in this wine from the recently named Estrella district. The flavors are well integrated, with mocha, espresso and black cherry most apparent.
Name: Vina Robles 2011 Estate Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black as night in the glass, the dark-leaning, attention-grabbing aromas range from black cherry to cassis, with some slate. The wine lacquers the palate with brooding purple fruit, boasting flavors of blackberry syrup, white pepper and violet.
Name: Brecon Estate 2012 Petite Sirah (Monterey County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Lavish fruit and extravagant spicy oak flavors balance each other well in this big, showy, dark and tannic wine. The color is black almost to the rim, and it has plenty of body, thick tannins and concentrated boysenberry flavors. Best now through 2019.
Name: HandCraft 2012 Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This interesting and complex cool-climate Petite Sirah tastes more like its relative Syrah than usual—and it contains almost 10% Syrah. The aromas recall black pepper, roast beef and ripe blackberries. Tannins are firm but not massive, giving the texture a sense of layering and finesse.
Name: Criss Cross 2013 Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A delicious personality of chocolate-covered cherry and cocoa powder comes out right away in the aroma of this dense and deeply colored wine, and stays with it through the finish. It's full-bodied, nicely tannic, rich in fruit and spicy oak flavors, but not too too heavy. It should improve through 2019.
Name: Morse 2009 Estate Petite Sirah (Amador County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: An appetizing hickory-smoke aroma and bold fruit flavors make this one stand out, yet it doesn't go too far with the woody character. A hint of bacon blends well with the ripe blackberry flavors, and the rich texture and firm tannins make it a great wine to pair with big portions of protein.
Name: McManis 2013 Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A good look at the potential of the soon-to-be official Creston appellation, this opaque wine is scented with pickled cherries, black tea and sour herbal aromas. Balsamic vinegar leads the palate, which is showing a bit of age, so drink now.
Name: Vina Robles 2011 Creston Valley Vineyard Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: That friendly, familiar, cedar and cinnamon aroma that comes from oak barrels jumps out of the glass when sipping this full-bodied and deep-colored wine. It has gripping tannins that dry the mouth but will work well with pork, beef and lamb. And it blends in enough ripe fruit flavor for good balance. Best now through 2018.
Name: Winery by the Creek 2012 Reserve Avila Vineyard Petite Sirah (Fair Play)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine is very smooth and easygoing for this usually tannic grape variety. Still it has a rather deep color, attractive, fresh blackberry aromas, lots of juicy berry flavors, and moderate tannins to give it a bit of heft. It is medium-bodied and ready to drink.
Name: Ironstone 2012 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This rich, rewarding wine boasts a powerful nose of wild game, blackberry candy, pine tar and blood. The tannins are chewy and the flavors remain in the stewed blackberry range, a nice partner for dessert of chocolate cake.
Name: Pianetta 2011 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep plum and sweet tobacco leaf aromas mesh with sour and candied blueberry in this layered and luxurious wine from Petite Sirah specialists MCV. The palate is pleasantly broad, with chocolate and smoked cactus flavors, reminiscent of tequila. Both the tannins and acidity are proper and smooth.
Name: MCV 2012 Rosewynn Vineyard Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Scents of sesame oil rise to the forefront of the nose on this east Paso Robles estate wine, accompanied by violet, strawberry and black sage. The nicely balanced flavors touch upon cotton candy and pretty pink fruit.
Name: Still Waters 2010 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From Olsen vineyard grapes, this is brawny, ripe, dark and oaky—what else would you expect? It's a take-no-prisoners red that is loaded with spicy blackberry fruit. Tannins are ripe and in proportion, and the fruit has that notable lift from vivid acidity that sets Washington reds apart.
Name: Sparkman 2012 Ring of Fire Petite Sirah (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is an extreme example of an extreme varietal. The color is black except for a thin purple rim. The aromas are like dark chocolate and subdued blueberry. Flavors convey a deep profusion of blackberry and boysenberry with hints of sweet oak. Very full-bodied, full-flavored and mouthfilling, it delivers power with polish.
Name: Deaver 2010 Petite Sirah (Amador County)

Appellation: Maipo Valley, Chile
Description: On first take, this is reduced and flat smelling, but with time it evolves to show raisin, licorice and herbal aromas. The palate is jammy, full and loud. Flavors of prune, raisin and blackberry are herbal and feral in nature, while the finish is acidic and full of chunky, herbal flavors. Drink through 2017.
Name: Santa Rita 2010 Bougainville Petite Sirah (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Hearty, full-bodied, definitely rich and deeply colored. The chocolate and oak aromas lead to plenty of ripe blackberry and boysenberry flavors that come out on the palate and linger on the finish. It tastes big and tannic, yet the gushing fruit flavors balance everything out, and the overall impression is smooth and polished.
Name: Guenoc 2012 Petite Sirah (Lake County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This full-blown Petite Sirah should age nicely. It has a smoky, earthy, blackberrylike aroma and thick but tight texture. Flavors of cherry and blackberry are supported by a very firm layer of tannin. Full-bodied and well-structured, it should be best after 2017.
Name: Graziano 2010 Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Richness, ripeness and alcoholic strength all come together in this surprisingly smooth and Port-like wine. The very deep color stays black almost to the rim. Full-bodied but not harsh, it smells like prunes and boysenberries and tastes like dark-chocolate-coated cherries. Pair with cheese or a cigar.
Name: Sol Rouge 2011 Petite Sirah (Lake County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blackberry scents hide behind a barrage of cigar box, graphite and burnt toast in this brooding wine. Mocha, cedar, blueberry and boysenberry jam arrive once sipped, alongside sagebrush that gives herbal lift.
Name: Epiphany 2011 Rodney's Vineyard Petite Sirah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A relatively light and civilized version of a notoriously dark and full-bodied varietal. The color is a medium purple. An aroma of grilled vegetables leads to satisfying cherry flavors carried on a moderately tannic but not extreme texture.
Name: Oak Grove 2012 Family Reserve Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Completely opaque in the glass, the strong nose blends brandy, cherry syrup and coffee. It's a bit tannic once sipped, with flavors of blueberry soda and prune.
Name: San Simeon 2010 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: An inky black 100% Petite Sirah that's smoky and soft, luxurious in nuanced and complex layers of black and blueberry fruit, black pepper and wild game. An incredible offering from the Napa Valley.
Name: C. Beck 2010 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Black as night, it offers classic characteristics. Oodles of black pepper on the nose and palate are seasoned over soft, lush tannins and hearty layers of licorice, dark chocolate and coffee. It's ready to enjoy now but will also grow gracefully over many years.
Name: Spellbound 2009 Reserve Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: There are small percentages of Syrah, Grenache, Carignane, Mourvèdre and Viognier in this Petite. Combined, they add to a greater whole of inky, coffee-mocha flavor around soft, restrained tannins. Blackberry and blueberry fruit also figure prominently, as good as your grandmother's pies.
Name: Stags' Leap Winery 2011 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A hearty, tannic, rich and enjoyably different red wine. This Durif—the French term for Petite Sirah—has a deep, red-black color. It offers meaty and plummy flavors, good firm tannins and richness in the texture. A thread of ripe fruit carries over to the finish. Enjoy it with equally rich food.
Name: Berryessa Gap 2011 Club Series Durif (Yolo County)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Leather saddle and gingerbread spice come to mind first, followed by savory black pepper, more leather and plenty of dark coffee on the palate. Layered and juicy it has plenty of muscle and power.
Name: Keating 2011 Petite Sirah (Rockpile)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A blend of 73% Petite Sirah with 17% Zinfandel, this is a black, inky wine, as to be expected, from Spring Mountain's longstanding York Creek Vineyard. Dusty, earthy and mouthfilling, it is out and out savory. Tastes of black pepper and gamy oak lead to a lingering finish marked by more peppery spice.
Name: Elyse 2010 York Creek Vineyard Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine offers a lighter side of Petite Sirah. It conveys more red fruit than brooding black and blue, a taste of red licorice and lean, balanced red cherries sleekly layered over earthy plum and spice. Its structure and acidity make it food-friendly, ready to accent a black pepper steak or similarly seasoned roast.
Name: Miro 2012 Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Brambly soft vanilla marks this wine that's otherwise bright in blueberry fruit and zesty acidity. Medium in weight, it has an abbreviated finish.
Name: Anaba 2011 Teldeschi Vineyard Home Ranch Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dark in color, the wine is meaty, dry and brambly in wild strawberry. It's easy to drink and like, with a smooth, hearty finish.
Name: Field Stone 2013 Heritage Block Rosé of Petite Sirah (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: There's plenty of dark chocolate and full-throttled blueberry fruit in this Petite Sirah from a producer with a longstanding history with the grape. Subtle yet chewy black pepper plays on the palate, finishing in a waft of smoke.
Name: Foppiano 2011 Estate Bottled Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Along with the Dolcetto, this Petite Sirah tops the new releases for this micro-boutique winery. Bright and lightly toasty, it's a forward wine, with pretty cherry, cola and earth components. An appealing and supple streak of leather comes with hints of spice and butterscotch, all woven together seamlessly.
Name: Animale 2011 Petite Sirah (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Judean Hills, Israel
Description: A nose of tart cherry, tomato leaf and Mediterranean herbs primes the palate for flavors of cherry, cranberry, green olive and thyme with a trace of eucalyptus. Although at first the tannins can be a bit gum-numbing, as the chewy quality recedes there is a nice play between brightness and rich texture.
Name: Montefiore 2010 Petite Sirah (Judean Hills)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
