Description: Licorice, cigar box and a touch of mint highlight the ripe plum-driven aromas on this wine from New Orleans-hailing, Santa Ynez-residing Iris Rideau. A plush mouthfeel comes alongside blueberry notes and apparent tannins that aren't overly grippy. It's a little hot, but also retains an refreshing acidity.
Name: Rideau 2011 La Presa Petite Sirah (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Cherry and sautéed morels provide an intriguing introduction to this deeply hued wine, but there are also hints of something funkier, like wet newspaper. On the palate, the pleasing black cherry returns, as does anise, some bitter elements and chewy tannins.
Name: Fazeli Cellars 2010 Petite Sirah (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Petite Sirah has a long history in Livermore Valley and the Del Arroyo Vineyard from which this wine hails is planted to the heritage Concannon clone. Restrained and spicy, it offers velvety blackberry and raspberry fruit and a lingering tropical aroma, encased with a morsel of dark chocolate. With well-managed tannins, the wine begs to be set on the table alongside peppery steaks.
Name: Occasio 2011 Del Arroyo Vineyard Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Pretty in floral spiciness, this wine is a worthy continuation from the previous vintage, leathery and restrained, more soft red and blue fruit than burly black. Smooth and earthy, the finish is lingering. This food-friendly Petite Sirah is ready to enjoy now with a hearty roast.
Name: Cedar Creek 2009 Petite Sirah (Fair Play)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: From a dry-farmed vineyard and treated to wild yeast and minimal new French oak, this Petite is chewy in leathery tannins, a definite crowd pleaser for Petite fans. Blackberries, coffee and pepper commingle impressively.
Name: Olabisi 2008 King Vineyard Petite Sirah (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: Rich in sanguine, leathery, blackberry and chocolate flavors, this velvety Petite Sirah, with a nose of violets, offers both decadence and elegance. The finish is all about cinnamon toast with a bite of oak.
Name: Two Angels 2009 Petite Sirah (High Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Soft, light and layered in raspberry spice, this is a refreshing take on Petite Sirah, less about intensity than enjoyment. A fine food-pairing wine, it won't overtake the table, complementing peppery steaks and roasts with its own measured seasoning.
Name: McCay Cellars 2011 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Richly effusive, it's marked by blue and black berry fruit that's almost jammy, swathed in chocolaty toffee. The wine shows off Macchia's prowess with Lodi fruit, its acidity pert throughout, especially into the finish, which also features plenty of toasty oak.
Name: Macchia 2011 Rebellious Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A very good vintage for Chacewater PS, which has a handful of Petit Verdot blended in too. Offering ripe plum, raspberry and boysenberry fruit flavors, the wine is layered and restrained, the tannins well-behaved. On the finish, a taste of licorice peeks through.
Name: Chacewater 2011 Petite Sirah (Lake County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A tribute to Samuele Sebastiani, this Petite Sirah is blended with 17% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Merlot, most of the grapes from Lodi. It delivers a bigger-than-life glass of roasted plum and blueberry, bacon and earthy cedar. Soft and approachable now, the tannins are lushly present, the finish marked by toasty oak and vanilla.
Name: Americano 2011 Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Steeped in smoky black fruit, this is a chewier version of Petite, ripe and meaty, black as night. Amid the ripe black fruit, a flash of red fruit midway through a taste leads to the big, tannic finish.
Name: Macchia 2011 Bodacious Petite Sirah (Amador County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: With a strong undercurrent of bell pepper, this soft Petite Sirah has tense shadings of peppery spice and leather. Ready to drink now.
Name: Concannon 2010 Nina's Cuvée Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Hearty in red plum and raspberry, this smooth, structured Petite is ready to drink now, straightforward rather than complex.
Name: Black Bear, Red Chair 2011 Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This soft wine has a roasted fruit quality to it. Layers of jammy berry and plum show amidst a savory profile of tamed tannins and earth.
Name: Concannon 2009 Polo Field Vineyard 50th Anniversary Release Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Aromas of smoky leather jump out of the glass followed by chocolate and rich red fruit. The finish returns to the chocolate theme, accompanied by vanilla bean. Expect Petite Sirah's classic color and texture in this wine, a tremendous value for the price.
Name: Vinum Cellars 2010 Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This Petite is shy in forward fruit, showing a faint mix of red and blue berry, with a hint of leathery smoke in the background.
Name: Christine Andrew 2012 Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This Petite opens with pretty floral aromatics, followed by a core of structured, rich red fruit and a soft texture. It veers slightly sour on the finish.
Name: Wise Villa 2010 Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A pronounced char of toasty oak marks this wine most, the rest of it a combination of slightly overripe plum and chocolate.
Name: Spenker 2009 Estate Bottled Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This Petite Sirah has a strong aroma of farm and funk, and not much else to distinguish itself.
Name: Peirano 2012 The Heritage Collection Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Leather-boot black in color, this fine Petite Sirah is distinctive in herbal, almost eucalyptus aromas and intensely huge blackberry fruit. Earthy and soft with curtains of tannin, the wine is a complex version of the variety, rich. Age it until 2017–2021 and see if the eucalyptus mellows or intensifies.
Name: Sean Thackrey 2010 Sirius Eaglepoint Ranch Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Juicy in blackberry and plum, this is a velvety soft Petite Sirah with a backbone of leather and espresso and a long, fulfilling finish. Mouth-filling and fresh, this wine will play well with a heaping plate of grilled ribs or a proper roast.
Name: Peltier 2009 Peltier Station Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: South Coast, California, US
Description: Like a liquid blueberry cobbler, this is a juicy, soft, well-integrated red wine, leathery and roundly rich. Perfect for a rib roast meal with buttery mashed potatoes, let it breathe a half-hour or two before serving.
Name: Orfila 2011 Estate Petite Sirah

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: Closed at first and immediately tannic, this Petite opens up in vibrant ways, showing off a soft texture and earthy blackberry and blueberry flavors. Long on the finish, it's round enough to pair with something gamey.
Name: Shannon Ridge 2010 Caldwell Ranch Petite Sirah (High Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: With a handful of Barbera blended in, Fiddletown's Petite Sirah is intense in aromas of baked blackberry and blueberry fruit, akin to a cobbler, soft, the tannins well-integrated. Its finish curtailed mid-stream, it offers a pleasant layer of licorice throughout.
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2011 Petite Sirah (Amador County)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Big-boned and full of red cherry, this is a soft, balanced Petite Sirah with still-integrating tannins that should mellow with air or age. Slightly peppery on the finish, so a pepper steak would be lovely alongside it.
Name: Claudia Springs 2010 Vittorio Vineyard Petite Sirah (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Inky purple, as you might expect after 23 days on the skins, this hits the palate forcefully with flavors of blueberry, black cherry, mown grass and mulch. Tannins are thick and chewy, and the finish turns a bit chalky.
Name: Angel Vine 2011 Stonetree Vineyard Petite Sirah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Darkly seductive in cinnamon and blackberry, this wine is hugely mouth-filling and a tad chewy, ready for a gigantic steak off the grill, preferably while out on the range. Coffee and pepper figure prominently in this wine, especially on the finish.
Name: Parducci 2010 True Grit Reserve Petite Sirah (Mendocino)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A good-value Petite Sirah that's straightforward in texture and personality. Its blueberry fruit lurks shyly in the background and there's a send-off of sturdy tannin on the finish.
Name: Parducci 2010 Small Lot Blend Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: With small percentages of Syrah and Viognier, this Petite Sirah is simple and has a pronounced smoky personality.
Name: Peltier 2011 Hybrid Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Petite Sirah is deeply black in color and otherwise satisfactory though a bit disjointed, with an off-aroma of rubber peeking through.
Name: Las Positas 2011 Estate Bottled Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: WIth cinnamon-tinged lushness on the nose, this Petite is inviting from the start. It delves satisfyingly into raspberry and blackberry flavors with bits of toast and tar, especially on the finish. Soft and layered with a tannic bite, it's ready to drink now or lay down for several years.
Name: Andis 2010 Reserve Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: El Dorado County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A great price for a great wine, this Bea's Knees offers soft raspberry and leathery plum. Likewise it's soft, though not shy, in tannins. With savory cedar and espresso going on aside a long finish, it's ready to enjoy right now—thanks to the winery's holding back on release—and could further mellow into an even more savory self in time.
Name: People's Wine Revolution 2008 Bea's Knees Petite Sirah (El Dorado County)

Appellation: Guenoc Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: Aged for two-and-a-half years in American oak, this Petite Sirah shows off the variety's preference for aging, a study in dense, rounded tannins and juicy red and blue fruit. With savory hints of cedar wood and leather, it'll appeal to Petite fans and accompany roasts and grilled meats well.
Name: Langtry 2008 Serpentine Meadow Vineyard Petite Sirah (Guenoc Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Marked by savory cranberry and raspberry, the wine is high in acidity with a soft texture and long finish. The palate is underlined by an herbal component rounded out by a hit of tar. Aged mostly in American oak this wine is ready to drink now.
Name: Guenoc 2011 Petite Sirah (Lake County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A compellingly fresh herbal component characterizes this wine, particularly in the aroma. Still-tight tannins give a bitter note. Soft and ripe in blackberry and black licorice, it's a wine to enjoy now with a grilled steak dotted in peppercorns.
Name: Lava Cap 2010 Estate Bottled Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Generous in white pepper, particularly on the nose, this Petite has tight, puckering tannins pleading for more time in the bottle. Soft flavors lean to the leathery blackberry and licorice side of things.
Name: Cedar Mountain 2009 Reserve Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The wine offers a taste of cherry liqueur and blueberries that's soft, high in acidity and still a bit tight in tannins. This would be a good one to give a bit more time.
Name: Fenestra 2010 Ghielmetti Vineyard Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Galilee, Israel
Description: This is a deep violet-red wine, with aromas of blackberry, blueberry, butterscotch and anisette. Flavors of blueberry, toffee and licorice play off of strong woody notes that dominate the finish.
Name: Recanati 2012 Reserve Petite Sirah (Galilee)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: With a handful of Pinotage in the blend, this Petite is hearty in oaky tannins and blackberries, smooth and straightforward with a suggestion of earth and tar.
Name: McNab Ridge 2011 Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A widely distributed wine that'll please in yeasty strawberry and blueberry flavor and a yeasty nose. Soft and straightforward, the tannins are tamed and the profile more juicy than earthy.
Name: Spellbound 2012 Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A value-priced Petite Sirah that's massive and leathery in the mouth, soft in tannins and ready to pair with barbecue or blackened gator.
Name: Cycles Gladiator 2011 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: McManis offers value in its wines and this is no exception. Soft, easy-drinking and accessible in rich, red fruit, it's a handy wine to have around for crowds, especially for barbecues and other events involving slabs of meat.
Name: McManis 2012 Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged in a mixture of American and French oak (40% new), it's a palate stainer with notes of blue and purple fruit, chocolate and barrel accents. The rich fruit flavors pack a wallop along with firm tannins that lead to an oak spice filled finish. A big wine—not for the faint of heart.
Name: Dusted Valley 2011 StoneTree Vineyard Petite Sirah (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Guenoc Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: Aged for more than three years in French oak, this 100% Petite Sirah Port has Tawny character, cinnamon spicy smooth and dark, with a bite of acidity on the mid-palate. Smooth with a long finish, its flavors lean toward blueberry and dark chocolate. It has 70 g/L residual sugar.
Name: Guenoc 2008 Serpentine Meadow Vineyard Petite Sirah (Guenoc Valley)

Appellation: Valle de Guadalupe, Mexico
Description: Smooth ripe-fruit aromas of raisin and blackberry lead to a jammy feel and concentrated palate that's home to baked black-fruit and molasses flavors. A gritty, grippy finish holds its form. Drink now.
Name: L.A. Cetto 2008 Private Reserve Petite Sirah (Valle de Guadalupe)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Complex in Middle Eastern and baking spices, Occasio's Petite Sirah is meant to be a tribute to the Livermore Valley's early days of viticultural promise and it delivers in a modern way. With a juicy mouthfeel of red and black fruit, it retains vibrant acidity and finishes long.
Name: Occasio 2010 Del Arroyo Vineyard Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Decadent in coffee, toffee and caramel tones, the leathery mouthfeel of this wine is met head-to-head by a juiciness of ripe, dense blackberry fruit. An approachable Petite Sirah that will also please lovers of the variety's chewiness and concentration.
Name: Nine North Wine Company 2010 Seven Sinners Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a Petite Sirah that's easy to love, ripe in sweet blackberry and smoky leather, juicy and balanced with enough meat to pair with a lamb roast or rack of ribs.
Name: Graziano 2009 Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A rich, thick, inky purple Petite Sirah with a small amount of Syrah blended in, offering aromas of baked plum, boysenberry and leathery spice. Elegant for the variety, the wine is concentrated and structured with a long finish of dark coffee.
Name: Di Arie 2009 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Hovey's Petite offers mountainous tannins that are still soft and structured, mellowed by the bright red raspberry and blackberry fruit encased in baking spice.
Name: Hovey 2011 Petite Sirah (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: All leather, no lace, this spicy Petite Sirah is rugged in tannins with pronounced flavors of coffee and baked blackberry fruit.
Name: Mineral Wines 2009 Petite Sirah (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A Petite Sirah abundant in black pepper and cinnamon spice, structured, ripe and leathery. The tannins show promise for aging 5–7 years, the wine's black fruit waiting to burst forth.
Name: Aver Family Vineyards 2009 Blessings Petite Sirah (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Unexpectedly aromatic in jasmine and rose, Parducci's True Grit is otherwise big with a coated mouthfeel of leather, amidst a wall of toned tannins.
Name: Parducci 2009 True Grit Reserve Petite Sirah (Mendocino)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a dark, brooding wine with notes of black fruit, earth, Band Aid and spice. It's tart with firm, blocky tannins.
Name: Folin Cellars 2010 Folin Vineyards Petite Sirah (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: Produced entirely from Petite Sirah, this wine is dark in color, with notes of cherry, melon and strawberry. It's a bit ponderous but still offers enjoyment.
Name: Koenig Vineyards 2011 Dry Rosé of Petite Sirah

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: A distinctly sweet-smelling wine, with notes of stewed black cherry, oak spices, and citrus. The tannins are firm and the alcohol shows prominently.
Name: Fujishin 2010 Petite Sirah

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Black and viscous, this gorgeous Petite Sirah is intriguing in every way. Opening with aromas of just-muddled mint and freshly baked bread, this wine tastes as if wildflowers and brambly blackberry stems were placed carefully in a leather satchel. No doubt this Petite will get even more interesting with age.
Name: Sirius 2010 Eaglepoint Ranch Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A pure Petite Sirah from 36-year-old vines grown in decomposed granite soil, this Cedarville bottling is appropriately purple-black in color, and rich with milk chocolate and licorice flavor. It's soft with juicy tannins, and boasts a long, luxurious finish. It'll sit quietly in the cellar for 10–15 years, if not longer, a commanding study in the evolved beauty of Petite Sirah.
Name: Cedarville 2010 Naylor Vineyard Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Strong tannins are a given with varietal Petite Sirah, and they are here in force, along with dark, deep notes of licorice, vanilla and cassis fruit. It's a big wine throughout, with very ripe fruit that never veers into jammy flab. Just plain delicious all the way through the long finish.
Name: Dusted Valley 2010 Petite Sirah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Smoky and teeth staining with savory blackberry fruit, this Petite is balanced, with a long finish, and will get better with 3–7 years of bottling age. Think grilled meats when pairing.
Name: Fields Family 2010 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Black in color and super earthy with reams of smoke, this Lodi Petite Sirah has 8% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Cabernet Franc blended in, giving it a touch of finesse. The soft tannins are balanced by the wine's heft as well as the permeating aromas and flavors of charcuterie, tobacco and blackberry jam.
Name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2010 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Not surprisingly, this young wine has dense, potent tannins, along with plenty of stem and herb accents. It's balanced texturally, and has rather acidic, young fruit flavors of cranberry and raspberry. At the moment it is the most chewy and tannic of all the 2010 reds from Animale.
Name: Animale 2010 Petite Sirah (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a linebacker wine, at 15.7% abv, bursting with roasted coffee, licorice and dry tannins all around. Soft, supple and round, and fully concentrated, the finish could use a bit more harrumph. The back label's suggestion to pair this wine with short ribs is a good call.
Name: Trinitas 2010 Old Vine Petite Sirah (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Spicy with a layering of pepper this Lodi Petite Sirah, clocking in at only 12.5% abv, is Syrah-like in aroma and flavor, but fully Petite in its very dry tannins.
Name: Harlow Ridge 2011 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Made from organic grapes, Green Truck's Petite has not a lot going on aromatically and exhibits very little in the way of the variety's profile, tasting like generic red wine.
Name: Green Truck 2010 Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The oak plays a prominent role here with notes of char, marshmallow and vanilla out in front of herbs and dark cherry. It's bold and structured with a firm squeeze of tannins and tart acidity.
Name: Bunnell 2009 Northridge Vineayrd Petite Sirah (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a very herbal and chocolaty Petite Sirah that's characteristically dark and inky. Tannins are under control and the palate a concentrated mix of ripe blueberry, game and black pepper. Sourced from a single vineyard site in the Livermore Valley and aged in all new American oak, this baby can age well another 3–5 years or be enjoyed now with equally robust food.
Name: Nottingham Cellars 2010 Casas de Vinas Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: From a region and producer more widely known for Chenin Blanc comes this very drinkable Petite Sirah with chewy blue fruit, coffee, toasty coconut and oak. There's enough structure and girth to age a while, so pair it in a few years with roasted or braised meats, a giant slab of steak or any other suitably hearty meal.
Name: Clarksburg Wine Company 2010 Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: An intense and inky Petite Sirah adorned with licorice and silky plum and blueberry flavors. With just the right amount of meatiness and softened tannins, this structured wine has a fine accent of spice on the finish and will age for years and years to come.
Name: Two Angels 2008 Petite Sirah (High Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A fine Mendocino Petite Sirah that's mouth filling with blueberry and licorice and plenty structured to age longer than it already has. With pleasant layers of licorice and black tea, especially on the finish, it's also ready to drink now.
Name: Graziano 2007 Petite Sirah (Mendocino)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A big bottle of dessert wine, all from Petite Sirah grapes, that's rich and soft and round, with Petite's characteristic dusty flavors and a kick of chocolate on the finish. A dessert on its own, it would pair well with savory cheeses or something nutty.
Name: Barra of Mendocino 2008 Bella Dolce Petite Sirah (Mendocino)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is made from fruit that's sourced mostly from Mercer's Spice Cabinet Vineyard in the Horse Heaven Hills, with some Tablas clone Syrah from the Rattlesnake Hills. It's a tasty wine but it seems incomplete. It has a ripe purple-fruit flavor, and it comes with plenty of power, but there's a hole in the middle. The finish kicks in with a splash of molasses.
Name: Ott & Murphy 2009 Petite Sirah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Capturing the dense essence of Petite Sirah, this marries deep berry flavor to a highlight of Bourbon-soaked chocolate. It's not overly sweet, but it's definitely a dessert wine.
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2010 Mistelle Petite Sirah (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Here is a full-throttle mouthful of brambly berry fruit, with generous accents of dried herb and underbrush. The melding of fruit and herb is perfect, with clean, polished tannins.
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2010 Petite Sirah (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A complex, dark-cherry-flavored Petite Sirah, this is marked by bright fruit and tame tannins, giving the wine a mouthwatering vibrancy. Intense but full of life, bottle aging has helped this wine, as it often does with a variety like Petite Sirah, which can be overwhelming when young. In this case, the years have opened it up, lending an elegance that makes the wine ideal for meaty foods.
Name: Sheldon 2007 Deviant Velocity Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Winemaker Ed Fus does a superb job with grapes from the Stonetree Vineyard, as this tasty young Petite Sirah demonstrates. Violet, chalk, blueberry and citrus notes combine on the palate, continuing onto the finish that sets flower and tannin in stark opposition. This is what pure Petite Sirah from an excellent site tastes like, with no intrusive new oak flavors.
Name: Angel Vine 2010 Stonetree Vineyard Petite Sirah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A bold, brawny Petite Sirah from the Sierra Foothills, this is gigantic and muscular. It has big expressions of milk chocolate and red raspberry, with puckering tannins that are interesting and built to age. Licorice, spice and a hint of smoky violet mark the rest of its profile.
Name: Cedar Creek 2008 Estate Petite Sirah (Fair Play)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a concentrated, leathery Petite Sirah, with gobs of milk chocolate, mellowed tannins and decent depth. With a back layer of peppery spice, it's ready to drink now. An everyday wine that'll pair well with meaty dishes covered in sauce.
Name: Artezin 2010 Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A dark, jammy explosion of baked red fruit and blackberry, this is marked by its toasty oak and its subtle hint of bacon, benefitting from breathing for 10–20 minutes before drinking. Full in body and tannin, it has a vanilla-infused finish.
Name: The Crusher 2011 Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: It's hard to get around the tannins that battle in this wine, which is savory and dark with a smoky aura. Lay it down another couple of years or let it air out a bit before pouring.
Name: Penumbra 2010 Petite Sirah (North Coast)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A gigantic mouthful of sinewy tannins, Earthquake Petite is big and generously loaded with dark plum and raspberry flavors. A highway of bittersweet chocolate and tar circle through the sizeable finish. Drink it with rich, hearty food.
Name: Earthquake 2010 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This opens with a smack of bright red fruit, dark plum and leathery pouch overtones, with a slight hint of licorice on the finish. Pair with big, bold foods.
Name: Bray 2008 Petite Sirah (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: Black and thick, this Petite Sirah delivers on all the variety's attributes in warm-climate California. It's blisteringly gregarious yet rounded, with smoky dark-fruit flavors that are initially hard to capture and tannins that verge on puckering. But time rewards—this wine hits its stride after being allowed to open and swirled around a few times. Enjoy it with a rich risotto or rack of ribs.
Name: Olabisi 2007 King Vineyard Petite Sirah (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A 100% Petite Sirah, this is inky, dark and thick, exuding tobacco, blackberry and an old-school rusticity true to its Mendocino roots.
Name: Parducci 2008 True Grit Petite Sirah (Mendocino)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: With the variety's signature dark black fruit, earthy tobacco and leathery accents going on, this is a good starter wine for those curious to try Petite Sirah.
Name: Line 39 2011 Petite Sirah (North Coast)

Appellation: Maipo Valley, Chile
Description: This smells a bit green, with aromas of herb, juniper, cola and earthy black fruit. It feels tannic, with an herbal core. A minty, briary flavor of herb-scented blackberry leads to the firm, tight finish.
Name: Carmen 2009 Gran Reserva Maipo Alto Petite Sirah (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a brambly, blueberry-laden Petite Sirah, with black cherry, plum and chocolate highlights. Firm, ripe tannins bring a streak of lemon verbena. It's gently earthy, absolutely flavorful and drinking beautifully.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 2009 Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Petite Sirah (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Made from estate-grown fruit sourced high in the Sierra Foothills, this is a black, true-to-type Petite Sirah. It's packed with dusty coffee, chocolate and tobacco.
Name: Naggiar 2009 Estate Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a smoky, fruity Petite Sirah, with 15% Syrah and 5% Viognier in the blend. It's round and drinkable now, with a dark berry flavor and specks of coffee and chocolate.
Name: Peltier 2007 Hybrid Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Grown in the High Valley appellation within Lake County, this is huge, black and packed with blackberry and blueberry flavors. It's decadent like a blueberry pie topped with chocolate sauce. Ready to drink now.
Name: Shannon Ridge 2010 High Elevation Collection Petite Sirah (Lake County)

Appellation: Clear Lake, Lake County, California, US
Description: A tannic and ripe Petite Sirah, this has flavors of plum, dark chocolate and a serious shot of espresso. This is a big bomb of a wine that needs braised meat to match it.
Name: Vagabond 2009 Arrighi Vineyard Petite Sirah (Clear Lake)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Dry and leathery, this is a classic, old-school Petite Sirah. It's intense and full bodied, with round edges that make it ingriguing and easy to drink.
Name: Claudia Springs 2009 Vittorio's Vineyard Petite Sirah (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Almost all Petite Sirah, with just 4% Syrah in the blend, this is purple and black in both color and fruit flavor. It packs in ample barrel flavors of licorice and coffee due to the aging regimen of 75% new French oak and 25% neutral. The tannins are hard, chewy, but plenty ripe. This is a bruiser.
Designation: Mr. Big Destiny Ridge Vineyards Estate Grown
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2009 Mr. Big Destiny Ridge Vineyards Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Heavy accents of vanilla and black tea as well as sharp acids and drying tannins characterize this Petite Sirah. If you like your reds big, brawny and oak soaked, this is your poster child.
Name: Dusted Valley 2009 Petite Sirah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Most of the grapes for this wine were sourced in Lodi. For a 24,000-case production, this has plenty of personality. Spice, tobacco and coffee notes jump out first, followed by straightforward blueberry, jammy yumminess.
Name: Spellbound 2010 Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Fresh, full bodied and juicy, this has flavors of dusty, dark plum and chocolate. It was aged in both French and American oak, which has added a background note of tobacco and vanilla on the palate, particularly on the finish.
Name: Shannon Ridge 2009 Ranch Collection Petite Sirah (Lake County)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From the Stonetree Vineyard, this supersaturated wine is so black that it looks impenetrable. The dark cassis fruit is drenched in astringent, tongue-drying flavors of smoke, asphalt and tar. Though true to its variety, it's a tough, chewy, somewhat chalky mouthful.
Name: Covington 2009 Petite Sirah (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Sharp and volatile aromas introduce this dark, chalky red. It needs to be paired with a seriously juicy, fatty red meat to buffer the the tannins.
Name: Agate Ridge 2008 Estate Petite Sirah (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: Dark black like the grapes it's made from. Once you get past its high alcohol, this has powerful flavors of dark chocolate, tar and baked plums.
Name: Stuessy Cellars 2010 My Sweet Petite Petite Sirah (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Miraflores continues to make a compelling case for El Dorado Petite Sirah with this yeasty, vanilla cream- and blueberry molasses-infused wine. Its tannins smoothed out a bit, but they'll still coat the sides of your mouth, with notes of oak and milk chocolate surfacing on the finish.
Name: Miraflores 2009 Estate Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An intensely fruity Petite full of plum and aromas of strawberries dipped in chocolate. Blended with 10% Mourvèdre, the wine is soft and round, with tame tannins. It finishes long, with a taste of char and Sweet Tarts, in a good way.
Name: Twisted Oak 2008 Petite Sirah (Calaveras County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The fruit component of this wine is at first elusive, its aromas dominated by dust, earth and saddle leather, but it opens over time into plum and chocolate and a sweetly spicy layer too. It's structured like a wall, so give this baby some time to further develop its assets.
Name: Lava Cap 2009 Granite Hill Reserve Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: A brawny, dusty Petite with ripe flavors of plum and black fruit enveloped by sticky tannins.
Name: Chacewater 2009 Petite Sirah (Red Hills)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A mellow, well-rounded Petite that could almost be mistaken for blueberry tea, so prominent are those two strains of flavor in this wine.
Name: Fenestra 2008 Ghielmetti Vineyard Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Animale's newest Petite Sirah includes 15% Cabernet Franc in the blend, a welcome addition that adds some dried herbs to the mix of bright berries and earthy tannins. It's dark, powerful red wine, from a cool site in a warm vintage.
Name: Animale 2009 Petite Sirah (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A hugely purple Petite with layers of black pepper, bacon fat, cedar and earth. It's chewy and inky but in balance; its tannin structure is as thick as walls yet the wine's stewy plum goodness goes down easy.
Name: Cedarville 2009 Naylor Vineyard Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

Appellation: Judean Hills, Israel
Description: Dusty cocoa and tree bark notes lead the nose, with additional supporting characteristics of black licorice, jerky, cigar box and tar. Mulled boysenberry and blackberry fruit forms the center. Bold and expressive, this fairly intense wine shows excellent concentration and depth of flavors. Pair with similarly assertive red-meat entrées.
Name: Carmel 2007 Appellation Old Vines Petite Sirah (Judean Hills)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is lovely in violet perfume and bacony leather, structured like a tall building and best left to mellow out for further development. Winemaker John Kinney destemmed without crushing to preserve as many whole berries as he could, and kept the wine fermenting at lower temperatures to tame the tannins.
Name: Occasio 2009 Del Arroyo Vineyard Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A blend of estate-grown vineyards and fruit from Casa de Vina, one of Livermore's most dazzling vineyard sites, Page Mill has made a Petite with a sweet nose of red fruit and very soft tannins.It's docile in style and subdued, but its licorice and chocolate notes are deliciously vibrant on the finish.
Name: Page Mill Winery 2007 Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Age has been kind to this Petite, one of Concannon's smalller bottlings. The wine is noticeably easygoing with mellowed plum and blackberry fruit and tamed tannins.
Name: Concannon 2007 Heritage Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concannon's Reserve Petite swirls in plum, dark chocolate and coconut with densely layered tannins that are expertly contained. No puckering here.
Name: Concannon 2008 Reserve Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: A delightfully easy-drinking Petite Sirah with cherry fruit and licorice overriding a subtle note of tobacco. Drink now.
Name: Line 39 2010 Petite Sirah (North Coast)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A classic Concannon Petite with plum and meat that's nicely integrated, smooth going down and resplendent in aromatics, topped off with a cherry finish. Captain Joe was the founder of Concannon's son, a member of the first American calvary.
Name: Concannon 2008 Captain Joe's Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: There's no doubt this is 100-percent Petite Sirah, full of dark plummy fruit and an earthy element that's close to mushrooms and dirt. Aged over two years in French oak the wine even has a slight hint of game and caramel. The tannins are soft but ample.
Name: McCay Cellars 2008 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A spicy, blackberry Petite marked by stewed plums, anise and tar.
Name: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2008 Madden Ranch Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Whoa... need... water. Michael David's Earthquake is all about impact, no bones about it. And this one won't disappoint people who like their wine like finely aged Scotch, high in alcohol. For them, its bold smoky chocolate, savory bacon on toast notes will be delightful.
Name: Michael David 2009 Earthquake Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark, deep purple in color, this Petite grown in Contra Costa is still quite closed and tight with no signs of opening anytime soon.
Name: Hannah Nicole Vineyards 2009 Reserve Petite Sirah (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Almost black in color, the Hovey Petite is layered and concentrated, deep and soulful with flavors of lavender, berry and licorice segued by a coffee and tobacco kicker. A true Petite Sirah lovers' Petite Sirah.
Name: Hovey 2008 Dalton Cuvee Petite Sirah (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From the excellent Stonetree vineyard, just two barrels were made. Seductive, ripe and jammy blueberry and blackberry fruit soaks the tongue, set against firm but well-balanced tannins. The fruit is spectacular, and the wine takes its high alcohol in stride.
Name: Angel Vine 2009 Stonetree Vineyard Petite Sirah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A brambly, still-quite tannic 80% Petite Sirah with 20% Syrah that's full of dark plum and cherry jam flavors and a thread of coffee throughout that gets pleasantly perfumey over time.
Name: Andis 2009 Reserve, Goedeck-Liu Vineyard Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A superdark, marshmellowy Petite Sirah that's grapey good, very jammy, surrounded by cinnamon and nutmeg. Grown eight miles east of the Santa Cruz Mountains, Martin Ranch's Petite is of course, not petite, but chewy and good, in search of a good hunk of meat.
Name: Martin Ranch 2007 Thérèse Vineyards Madeline Vineyards Petite Sirah (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Black purple, this older Petite has a deeply perfumed nose of licorice and chocolate and is very drinkable now.
Name: Broll Mountain Vineyards 2007 Petite Sirah (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Nina's has an oaky nose with roasted, nutty aromatics, and in flavor just teeters over the acceptable brink of enjoyable intensity. Lots of baked plum that's quite nice.
Name: Concannon 2008 Nina's Cuvee Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Zephyr Ridge vineyard provides the fruit for this brambly Petite Sirah. It was aged for 22 months in American oak, and has that roughshod character, a mix of wild berry, garrigue and clean earth.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 2008 Petite Sirah (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: Grown 2,200 feet in elevation, Angel's Secret Petite is a black monster, peppery and flavored of caramel molasses and plenty of dark berry notes. Give it another couple months to age and pair it with big game and all will be well.
Name: Angel's Secret 2010 Petite Sirah (High Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Winemaker Collin Cranor is superexcited about Casa De Vinas, a vineyard much talked about in the Livermore Valley. His Petite Sirah is clearly not petite, but everything PS lovers will love: oaky, dark and ripe, with smoke, chocolate and textured tannins.
Name: Nottingham Cellars 2009 Casa De Vinas Reserve Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: Quite tannic, with a mix of chocolate, black cherry, and raisins. High toned and rough.
Name: Fujishin 2008 Reserve Petite Sirah

Appellation: Guenoc Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: Guenoc/Langtry makes a more accessible, $17 Petite Sirah under its Guenoc label but for true Petite Sirah aficionados this Serpentine Meadow vineyard-designated wine is really the one to reach for. Closed at first, the wine is dark, earthy and tannic, heady with blackberry and cherry but especially licorice, with a well-executed, balanced finish. Could cellar 3–5 years at least.
Name: Langtry 2007 Serpentine Meadow Vineyard Petite Sirah (Guenoc Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: For a fairly large production, turn-key Petite Sirah this one is very worthwhile, with a fully fruity nose of dark plum and blackberry that gets broody with notes of clove and cinnamon. The wine's got good balance for a PS, is even-keeled and yet has plenty of meat on its bones. A great go-to Petite Sirah.
Name: Guenoc 2009 Petite Sirah (Lake County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Collin Cranor is a young, eager winemaker looking to make his mark in the Livermore Valley and this wine shows off his skill and ability to work with great fruit to make an interesting wine. Savory, this Petite Sirah has classic notes of chocolate, cherry and berry, though it benefits from a bit of air and time to open. Try it with meaty dishes; if they include bacon, all the better.
Name: Nottingham Cellars 2009 Black Label Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine shows effort and potential. It's simple at first, more tannic than fruity, with a hint of licorice and spice, its tannins grippy and a touch bitter and the long finish a little smoky/toasty. A good intro to Lake County Petite Sirah.
Name: Cache Creek Vineyards 2006 Petite Sirah (Lake County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Big and chewy and inky black, this clearly well-crafted Petite Sirah is full of black fruit—mostly blackberry—and peppery tones. The tannins stand out and yet mellow as the wine opens. A few more years in bottle should get them to the appropriate place. Enjoy this wine with a pepper steak or ravioli.
Name: Saracina 2007 Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Juicy as a dark plum with a raspberry chaser, this 80-case Petite Sirah gets better and better as it opens, revealing itself to be mellow and rustic, yet big and broad-shouldered. It would make the perfect pairing with a plate of cheesy pasta, meat sauce and crusty garlic bread, or anything with pancetta.
Name: Chiarito 2007 Estate Bottled Petite Sirah (Mendocino)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This old vine Petite Sirah gets the royal French oak treatment, the grapes organically grown at Testa Vineyard. This has very nuanced raspberry throughout its big, concentrated and sensuous body, the mid-palate showing its oak but the wine is still very young. Give it air and a few more years to age.
Name: Horse & Plow 2009 Testa Vineyard, Old Vines Petite Sirah (Mendocino)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This wine—sold direct only through the winery —gets better with time, with stony, cherry and cardamom brightening up through the tannins as the wine has a chance to breathe. Big and full, V. Sattui gets its grapes from mostly Lake County, rounding it out with a smaller percentage of Napa Valley fruit, as well as a handful from Dry Creek. Very solid.
Name: V. Sattui 2008 Petite Sirah (North Coast)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The Livermore Valley master of Petite Sirah outpaces much of its competition with Conservancy, a wine that honors land conservancy and is priced fairly. Well-made and very balanced for a larger production endeavor, this Petite opens with a nose of pepper and mocha, stewed berry and plum and develops into a full body that's lush and oaky but also shows plenty of minerality.
Name: Concannon 2008 Conservancy Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This 77% Petite Sirah has 23% Syrah blended into it, the result entirely satisfying with a rich full nose of dark berries and chocolate and spicy plum, the tannins a touch dusty in taste. This wine would be delicious with a meaty pizza or lasagna layered with meat and cheese.
Name: C.G. di Arie 2008 Estate Petite Sirah (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A rich, full Petite Sirah with a taste of cola and spice followed by ripe raspberry and blackberry. A very yummy version of the variety from one of Livemore's most promising vineyards.
Name: Fenestra 2007 Ghielmetti Vineyard Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Oregon Petite Sirah is certainly an outrider, but this is a commendable effort. It captures the dense blackberry fruit of the grape, wrangles the thick tannins into some sort of rough balance, and adds a lick of espresso to the finish. Blocky, tasty and proportionate.
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2009 Petite Sirah (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Livermore Valley Petite Sirah, from a producer that's done well with Syrah, is soft and round, docile even for a Petite Sirah, especially one at 14.8% alcohol. Opening with a hit of menthol and cocoa, the wine is fruit forward but tame and oaky throughout. Give it time to open and age.
Name: Page Mill Winery 2007 Estate Vineyard Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This is an easy-drinking Petite Sirah from an always solid producer of the variety. The wine is a little less in your face than many of its competitors with noticeable acidity and flavors of dark plum, mocha and spicy blackberry, though its finish could have been a little bit longer.
Name: Guenoc 2008 Petite Sirah (Lake County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Fragrant with a full body and discernible depth, this Sierra Foothills Petite is anything but—with giant tannins and a high alcohol level (15.2%) that makes its presence felt on the way down.
Name: Lava Cap 2008 Granite Hill Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

Appellation: El Dorado County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Big and tight and intense, a bottle for serious Petite Sirah lovers only. True Vine's wines are estate grown and aged for two years in American oak. Big and ageworthy. Marco Cappelli is the winemaker.
Name: True Vine 2007 Estate Petite Sirah (El Dorado County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Austere at first, even flowery, this Grands Amis Petite Sirah soon becomes more tannic and rough, its time spent in American oak evident, though the finish reveals some pleasing blueberry. Open this one up and let it breathe and pair with meaty meat.
Name: Grands Amis Winery 2006 Elk Vineyard, Borden Ranch Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Stewy yet intriguing with a taste of clove that finishes bitter, this Petite Sirah needs a rich risotto to stand next to.
Name: Ursa 2006 Naggiar Vineyards Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Muted and simple, a Petite Sirah that's oaky and has some sage and blackberry going on but a bit of a bitter finish.
Name: Diamond Ridge Vineyards 2008 Petite Sirah (Lake County)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Off in the nose with hints of sweet cherry, almost bubblegum, this Petite Sirah gets supertannic and oaky quick and just doesn't have enough fruit to pull it through.
Name: Little Stone Vineyard 2008 Petite Sirah (North Coast)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Very little Petite Sirah is grown in Washington. This is a fascinating expression of the grape, dark and tannic, deeply flavored but not at all sweet or sappy. Underbrush, wild berries, moist earth and pencil lead flavors cascade through the mouth, with green-tinged tannins rolling through the finish. Complex and unique.
Name: Animale 2008 Petite Sirah (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Petite Syrah (as it is spelled here) is no longer an approved label—Petite Sirah is correct—but this wine takes a good run a capturing the power and pleasure of the grape. Dark and tannic, it brings in plum and a hint of prune, also chocolate and earth, with good balance.
Name: Del Rio 2008 Estate Reserve Petite Sirah (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Barossa Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: An inky wine, yet remarkably well balanced and supple, marrying a lush, creamy texture with masses of blueberries and hints of mint and licorice. Drink now or hold up to 10 years.
Name: Massena 2006 The Howling Dog Petite Sirah (Barossa Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Not for everyone, this is the kind of Petite Sirah Quentin Tarantino would make if he made wine—big, in your face and ultimately a fine, bold wine full of intense black olive tapenade, chocolate and tobacco, with a tannic, peppery finish, a nod to its 22 months spent in French oak. Juicy and meaty and able to age another 5–7 years. Have some braised meat at the ready.
Name: Earthquake 2008 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A dusty, plummy, dark berry pie Petite Sirah from old vines grown in the Santa Clara Valley by the Guglielmo family, who have been based here since 1925. With lots of bittersweet chocolate, white pepper and well-integrated oak, this Petite is subtle, its alcohol relatively low and its tannins quite refined, a Petite for French palates.
Name: Guglielmo 2007 Private Reserve Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dark and dusty, this palate-coating wine shows well-managed tannins, smoothed just enough to unveil the strawberry, cherry and cassis fruit flavors. A mix of French and American (Wisconsin!) barrels brings toast and a wash of brine to the finish.
Name: Dusted Valley 2008 Petite Sirah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: Made in a soft, user-friendly style, the 2008 DB Family Selection Petite Sirah offers up a flavorful mouthful of plum and baking spices. It's medium-bodied, with a silkiness to the structure that belies the grape variety, yet that same softness makes it immediately appealing. Drink now.
Name: De Bortoli 2008 DB Family Selection Petite Sirah (South Eastern Australia)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pepper and black fruits comprise this pure Petite Sirah from one of Washington's warmest AVAs. Underscored with herb and earth, it is a far cry from the jammy monsters of California, but nicely made in a light and elegant style.
Name: Latah Creek 2008 Monarch Petite Sirah (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From one of Livermore's oldest producers, a small-production Petite Sirah, one of their specialties, all from an estate vineyard planted 40 years ago, this wine is super dark purple in color, very earthy, with nice chocolate and delicate fruit interspersed among the dusty tannins. Pretty and interesting.
Name: Concannon 2007 Nina's Cuvee Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Dusty, tannic and simple. Still, juicy and pleasant enough, with a touch of bitterness on the finish.
Name: Parducci 2007 Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Judean Hills, Israel
Description: Baked red fruit, cherry pie filling and sweet spice dominate the overall character of this wine, with a finish reminiscent of a Christmas fruit cake. Medium weight with vibrant acidity and a clean finish; easy drinking and ready now.
Name: Shiloh Winery 2007 Secret Reserve Petite Syrah Kosher Petite Sirah (Judean Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Limited production, tight and interesting. This 100% Petite Sirah is one of just a handful of varietal versions of the grape made in Washington. It features ripe berry flavors—blueberry in particular—wrapped in well-managed tannins with hints of caramel running through the finish. Still young, primary fruit, with a sharp edge to the tannins. Give it a couple more years in the cellar for optimal drinking.
Name: Angel Vine 2008 Stonetree Vineyard Petite Sirah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a well-balanced Petite Sirah, with chewy but proportionate tannins, a broadly fruity, black cherry core and nuanced highlights of apricot. The finish does a quick fade.
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2008 Petite Sirah (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Young vines, the first release from estate-grown fruit. The vanilla flavors of the barrels are front and center at the moment, though there are darker fruits in the background, along with smoke, licorice and a hint of tar. Good long-term potential.
Name: Folin Cellars 2008 Petite Sirah (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A grapey wine, forward with light, pretty cherry candy flavors. It starts out well, then doesn't build into anything, but rather fades quickly into a watery, generic red.
Name: Agate Ridge 2007 Petite Sirah (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a rather light, surprisingly delicate take on Petite Sirah, with pretty aromas of violets and spice. When first poured it seems shut down; it opens slowly but has a bit of a hole in the middle, before moving into a tannic finish with dark chocolate and licorice.
Name: Arbor Crest 2007 Wahluke Slope Vineyard Petite Sirah (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Judean Hills, Israel
Description: Medium weight with aggressive but balanced tannins. Intense notes of black plum, dark berries and purple florals dominate the nose and mouth, while soft accents of menthol and leathery spice add complexity to the finish.
Name: Carmel 2006 Appellation Old Vines Kosher Petite Sirah (Judean Hills)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A fine effort, without the heavy tannins of Californian Petit Sirah. Pretty purple fruits, soft and tart, with a strong scent and flavor of pickle barrel, dotted with black pepper.
Name: Bunnell 2007 Northridge Vineyard Petite Sirah (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% Petite Sirah, jet black, tannic and layered with hints of forest floor, fungus, dried leaf and wild berry. From the Zephyr Ridge vineyard, it's quite astringent, clearly varietal in character, and a fine example of what can be done with this grape in Washington State.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 2007 Petite Sirah (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Big indeed, this is very dark and concentrated, with fruit-powered flavors wrapped in sweet baking spices. An impressive Petite Sirah that does not seem too tannic; the barrel flavors—vanilla, cinnamon, brown sugar—more than compensate, and the fruit is round and ripe enough to hold the focus.
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2007 Mr. Big Petite Sirah (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fermented in neutral wood, this simple, straightforward wine is enjoyably grapey and plummy, the tannins are ripe, and though it is not particularly complex it is a perfectly enjoyable pizza wine.
Name: Corvidae 2007 Fable Petite Sirah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rutherglen, Victoria, Australia
Description: Despite substantial alcohol (16.5%), this admirably concentrated wine doesn't show that much heat, nor does it show any roasted, cooked character. Instead, it delivers black olive, leather and cassis flavors just tinged with mint and a fresh, lively finish hinting at coffee. The tannins are soft but present, helping to balance a hint of residual sugar. Drink now–2012.
Name: R.L. Buller & Son 2004 Calliope Limited Release Durif (Rutherglen)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: A well-made Petite Sirah with jammy fruit and some tannic structure, this wine could develop nicely over the next 5–6 years. Right now, the fruit is somewhat simple, but the acids and tannins seem to have the balance to age, and the fruit is concentrated enough to go at least that far.
Name: Oliverhill 2006 Petite Sirah (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: This rather chunky, grapy wine is a good alternative to the ubiquitous Bogle Petite Sirah from California, its only real competition in the value Petite Sirah segment. The dark fruit notes turn slightly dusty on the finish, hinting at black olives. Pair it with burgers, chops or steaks. Drink now–2012.
Name: De Bortoli 2007 dB Selection Petite Sirah (South Eastern Australia)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: This is nominally a step up from De Bortoli's dB Selection Petite Sirah, but this fresh, directly fruity wine doesn't seem to offer much beyond jammy fruit. It's medium-bodied, with a crisp finish and just a hint of tannic structure. Drink now–2012.
Name: De Bortoli 2006 Deen de Bortoli Vat 1 Petite Sirah (South Eastern Australia)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the fifth vintage for this rare Washington version of Petite Sirah. It is almost jet black in the center, purple at the rim, tight and tannic with plenty of acid sculpting the earthy, black cherry fruit. Loaded into the finish are layers of earth, iodine, tar and licorice; it's very well made and retains just enough roughness to satisfy lovers of this often rustic grape.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 2006 Zephyr Ridge Petite Sirah (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fans of Petite Sirah will find sweet blackberry fruit here, along with the grape's customary chalky tannins. Fruit flavors aside, there is more than a hint of green in the tannins and the finish; flavors descend into leaf, stem and bitter pip in rapid order.
Name: Spangler Vineyards 2006 Petite Sirah (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Barossa Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: This could easily stand alongside the best Petite Sirahs from California. It's perfumed and floral on the nose, then adds palate-staining blueberries and hints of cedar, licorice and chocolate. The silky tannins on the finish are firm enough to suggest cellaring through 2010, and optimum drinking through 2020, possibly longer.
Name: Massena 2005 The Howling Dog Petite Sirah (Barossa Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the fourth vintage for this rare Washington version of Petite Sirah, and the best yet. It doesn't have the sheer weight and bulk of California wines, but its firm acids, sweet tannins and ripe black cherry fruit adds a stylish, almost elegant spin to the grape.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 2005 Zephyr Ridge Petite Sirah (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The flagship Petite Sirah from the winery's own vineyards in the Livermore Valley is the biggest and richest wine in the lineup. The nose is filled with intense blueberries, but also picks up hints of licorice, flowers and grilled meat, while the flavors feature lush fruit and spice. Full-bodied and richly tannic, this should evolve well for years to come.
Name: Concannon 2004 Heritage Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The winery's signature bottling remains a staple for PS lovers. Dark berry flavors pick up hints of spice and herb on the tannic finish. It's reasonably full-bodied, but it does have a slightly tart, constricted feel to the finish. Drink now or hold 3–5 years.
Name: Concannon 2004 Limited Release Petite Sirah (Central Coast)

Appellation: Judean Hills, Israel
Description: Grown in the hills outside Jerusalem, this has a light touch, with a fruity nose that opens into straightforward strawberry and cherry flavors. Pleasant but not too memorable; finish needs length.
Name: Noah 2004 Gedeon Judean Hills Vineyards Kosher Petite Sirah (Judean Hills)

Appellation: Maipo Valley, Chile
Description: Years have gone by since we last rated this novelty, and all signs indicate that it has vastly improved. The amalgamation of fruit, tannin and acidity is quite impressive. The mocha and molasses that deck the finish is a rich, welcome touch. Big and unique; but beware of the rock-hard tannins. Imported by W.J. Deutsch & Sons.
Name: Carmen 2003 Reserve Petite Sirah (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Very little Petite Sirah is planted in Washington, and this may well be the first 100% varietal bottling ever made. It's a big, brawny wine as you would expect, done in a take-no-prisoners style. Inky and dense, with concentrated black cherry and blackberry flavors, along with some black pepper and bark.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 2002 Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Petite Sirah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Markham has been a reliable Petite source over the years, and succeeded even in the difficult '98 vintage. Rich blackberries and blueberries are dusted with black pepper. The one indication of a tough year is the dry, tannic finish, but it should work fine with a rare steak. —J.C.
Name: Markham 1998 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Rutherglen, Victoria, Australia
Description: This big and broodingly dark wine is packed with grapey fruit and vanilla. The tannins on the finish are dusty but ripe and should preserve the wine for up to 10 years in the cellar. Still, why not drink it now with barbecue and savor the youthfully lusty fruit? —J.C.
Name: Warrabilla 2000 Petite Sirah (Rutherglen)

Appellation: Rutherglen, Victoria, Australia
Description: This wine has an uncertain future, hence the less-than-enthusiastic rating. On first opening, it's mute on the nose and simply earthy and dull on the palate, with a dry, dusty finish. Later on, it opened up some and showed some nice aged fruit as well, then shut down again. —J.C.
Name: Campbells 1993 The Barkly Durif (Rutherglen)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A consistently fine wine, and the '97 doesn't miss a beat. Lavender and rose-petal aromas lead into a full mouthfeel that maintains terrific balance. Warm and spicy, the black fruit mixes nicely with some light woody notes. This one is drinkable right now, but the mildly tannic finish indicates that it will improve over the next 18 months.
Name: Foppiano 1997 Petite Sirah (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: From an old, organic vineyard, this is the winery's reserve-level Petite Sirah. The three “Ds” apply: deep, dense and decadent. Lots of big black-cherry and coffee flavor, with a chocolaty sensation created by direct, drying tannins. Gritty with a big taste profile. Should soften with time.
Name: Lolonis 1996 Orpheus Private Reserve Petite Sirah (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dusty and plummy on the nose, this is full-bodied on the palate, with black-cherry, chocolate and earth flavors. A briny soy-sauce component sneaks in to add complexity, and there's a pleasant peppery bite to the finish. Soft tannins make it drinkable now, but it should age well, too.
Name: Concannon 1995 Reserve Petite Sirah (Central Coast)

Appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: Quite dark, with plum and black-cherry aromas. Rich and thick; mouthfilling. Some anise/licorice notes. Finishes long, with some drying tannins that make for a tough mouthful now but should resolve nicely in time.
Name: Ridge 1996 York Creek Petite Sirah (Spring Mountain District)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Very flowery for a Pet, the violets pair nicely with blueberry aromas. Made in an early-drinking style with mild tannins, so don't feel as if you need to lock this one away. Enjoy it now and over the next two years for its satisfying midpalate and slightly peppery finish.
Name: Bogle 1998 Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Chile, Chile
Description: A little green and closed, it seems to be just a notch or two short of being special. There's good life to the fruit, but there's also a heavy minty quality and a bit too much American oak flavor. A relatively new and unusual (for Chile) effort with this grape by winemaker Álvaro Espinoza. Will likely be a better wine in future years.
Name: Carmen 1997 Reserve Petite Sirah (Chile)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A product of warm-weather, old-vine plants, this comes across a little too intense, a little too astringent. Sweet, pleasant fruit is a bit hard to find amid the bullet-like intensity. Time could be on its side, but for now it's a bit rough.
Name: Madrigal 1996 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
